original: @261b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @261b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra m'a n'a ba t'a ra ti ka bri tti /
analyzed: pra m'a n'a ba t'a ra ti ka bri tti /
translated: Pramanavarttikatika

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on the Pramanavarttika

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One.

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal zhing //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal zhing //
translated: Having completely removed the net of conceptualization,

original: zab cing rgya che'i sku mnga' ba //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che'i sku mnga' ba //
translated: Possessing a body that is profound and vast,üîΩI pay homage to Samantabhadra,

original: kun tu bzang po'i 'od zer dag / kun nas 'phro bar phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: kun tu bzang po'i 'od zer dag / kun nas 'phro bar phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Whose light rays radiate in all directions.

original: skye bo phal cher phal la chags shing shes rab rtsal med pas na legs bshad rnams //
analyzed: skye bo phal cher phal la chags shing shes rab rtsal med pas na legs bshad rnams //
translated: Since most people are attached to the ordinary and lack the power of wisdom,üîΩNot only do they not pursue the well-explained teachings,

original: don du mi gnyer kho nar ma zad phrag dog dri ma dag gis sdang bar yang //
analyzed: don du mi gnyer kho nar ma zad phrag dog dri ma dag gis sdang bar yang //
translated: But due to the defilements of jealousy, they even become hostile.

original: yongs gyur des na bdag la 'di ni gzhan la phan pa yin zhes bsam pa'ang med //
analyzed: yongs gyur des na bdag la 'di ni gzhan la phan pa yin zhes bsam pa'ang med //
translated: Therefore, I have no thought of benefiting others through this.

original: sems ni yun ring legs bshad goms pas lhur len bskyed phyir 'di la dga' ba skyes //
analyzed: sems ni yun ring legs bshad goms pas lhur len bskyed phyir 'di la dga' ba skyes //
translated: However, by cultivating the well-explained teachings for a long time, enthusiasm is generated, and thus joy arises in this.

original: don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: don dang don ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la brten pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The discernment of the real and the unreal is based on inference.

original: de la log par rtogs pas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩphyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa yi //
analyzed: de la log par rtogs pas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad pa / phyogs chos de'i chas khyab pa yi //
translated: And since that is established by wrong understanding, he says:üîΩThe reason is threefold:

original: gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de ni rnam gsum ste //
translated: the property of the position, pervasion by that part,

original: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges phyir ro //
translated: because of the certainty of the non-occurrence of the absence.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang de las gzhan //
translated: The fallacious reason is other than that.

original: phyogs ni chos can no //
analyzed: phyogs ni chos can no //
translated: The position is the subject.

original: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir nye bar gdags par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir nye bar gdags par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: If you say it should not be designated because it is purposeless,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos can gyi chos thams cad yin pa dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all the properties of the subject are negated,

original: de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is a part of that.

original: de nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nye bar gdags su rung ba'i chos can yin par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is suitable to designate it as the subject to be understood.

original: de lta yin dang mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mig gis gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, it would be rejected as being like ‚Äúbecause it is apprehended by the eye,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te chos zhes brjod pas kyang chos can yin par gzhi lta grub ste /
analyzed: gal te chos zhes brjod pas kyang chos can yin par gzhi lta grub ste /
translated: If you say that the subject is established as the property of the subject because the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù is mentioned,

original: chos can zhes smos pa'i shugs kyis nye ba yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par grub po zhe na /
analyzed: chos can zhes smos pa'i shugs kyis nye ba yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par grub po zhe na /
translated: and because the subject is implied by the force of the mention of the property of the subject,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dpe'i chos can yang nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe'i chos can yang nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the example subject is also implied.

original: de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya bas dpe'i chos can la yod pa grub pas chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: de'i chas khyab pa zhes bya bas dpe'i chos can la yod pa grub pas chos can gyi chos zhes smos pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin par yongs su gzung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the subject is taken to be the property of the subject because the phrase ‚Äúthe property of the subject‚Äù is mentioned, in order to establish that the property of the subject exists in the example subject, by the phrase ‚Äúpervasion by part of that,‚Äù

original: grub bzhin du bsnan pa'i phyir yang smos pa yin par yang dgos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: grub bzhin du bsnan pa'i phyir yang smos pa yin par yang dgos par 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be necessary to mention it again, because it is already established.

original: mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa @262a * //
analyzed: mthun pa kho na la yod pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa @262a * //
translated: It is said that it exists only in the similar instance, in order to establish that it is absent from the dissimilar instance.

original: las ldog pa grub mod kyi /
analyzed: las ldog pa grub mod kyi /
translated: Although it is established that it is absent from the dissimilar instance,

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa smos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa la med pa smos pa bzhin no //
translated: it is mentioned as ‚Äúabsent where the property of the subject is absent,‚Äù just as it is mentioned.

original: shugs kyis don go na rtogs par dka' ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang phyogs zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis don go na rtogs par dka' ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir yang phyogs zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúposition‚Äù is also mentioned in order to completely avoid the difficulty of understanding that the meaning of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be understood indirectly.

original: gal te phyogs kyi chos nyid yin na de'i khyad par la ltos pa gzhan la mi 'jug pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyogs kyi chos nyid yin na de'i khyad par la ltos pa gzhan la mi 'jug pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If the property of the position is the particular, then it is not shared by others because it does not occur in other things.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: dper na nag pa 'phong skyen no zhes bya ba lta bur mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir yin gyi /üîΩdper na srid sgrub 'phong skyen no //
analyzed: dper na nag pa 'phong skyen no zhes bya ba lta bur mi ldan pa rnam par bcad pas khyad par du byas pa'i phyir yin gyi / dper na srid sgrub 'phong skyen no //
translated: For example, it is like the expression ‚ÄúNƒÅga is skilled in archery,‚Äù where the particular is specified by the exclusion of nonpossession.

original: zhes bya ba lta bur gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bur gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par bcad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the expression ‚ÄúArjuna is skilled in archery,‚Äù where the particular is specified by the exclusion of possession by another.

original: bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is to be explained.

original: de'i cha ni smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i cha ni smra ba po'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de'i chos yin gyi /
translated: The part of that is the property of that, by the power of the speaker‚Äôs intention.

original: de'i phyogs gcig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a part of that.

original: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra spyi la mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs zhes bya ba'i sgra spyi la mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the term ‚Äúposition‚Äù is not used for a universal.

original: khyab pa ni de la khyab par byed pa yod pa kho na'am /
analyzed: khyab pa ni de la khyab par byed pa yod pa kho na'am /
translated: Pervasion is the existence of the pervader in that.

original: yang de kho na la khyab par bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de kho na la khyab par bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: and the pervasion is present in that alone.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag kyang bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas bshad la /
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa dag kyang bdag nyid ji lta ba'i tshad mas bshad la /
translated: This shows that the ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance is a valid means of cognition in its own right,

original: phyogs kyi chos kyang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos kyang bshad pa yin no //
translated: and that the property of the subject is also established.

original: de dag ni 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang / mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs gsum yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu dang / rang bzhin dang / mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gtan tshigs gsum yin te /
translated: These are the three kinds of reasons, which are characterized by effect, nature, and non-apprehension.

original: dper na du ba las ni 'di na me yod do //
analyzed: dper na du ba las ni 'di na me yod do //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere, fire exists because smoke exists.‚Äù

original: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni shing yin no //
analyzed: shing sha pa yin pa'i phyir 'di ni shing yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is a tree because it is a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ.‚Äù

original: phyogs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de /
analyzed: phyogs kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig na bum pa med de /
translated: ‚ÄúA pot does not exist in some particular place,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: because it is not apprehended, though it should be.‚Äù

original: gal te yod na dmigs par rung ba'i yod pa can kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te yod na dmigs par rung ba'i yod pa can kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it exists, it would exist only as something that can be apprehended.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be otherwise.

original: des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir 'gyur ba'i yod pa can zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir 'gyur ba'i yod pa can zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it would exist as something that can be apprehended.

original: de las gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: de las gnyis ni dngos po sgrub pa yin la /
translated: Of these, two are affirmative reasons,

original: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: gcig ni dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: and one is a negative reason.

original: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa yod pa don gyis don 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'brel pa yod pa don gyis don 'khrul pa med de /
translated: There is no error in the meaning of the reason that is related to the nature,

original: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of that.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i bye brag med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid yin na bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i bye brag med do zhe na /
translated: If it is the nature of that, there is no difference between the probandum and the proof.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so,

original: chos kyi bye brag kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi bye brag kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference of the property is imagined.

original: zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is how it should be explained.

original: de skad du rjes su dpag pa dang / @262b rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi bye brag kho nas yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du rjes su dpag pa dang / @262b rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tha snyad 'di thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi bye brag kho nas yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is said that all of these conventions of inference and the inferred are only due to the difference of the property and the subject that exist in the mind.

original: chos dang chos can nyid du tha dad pa blo'i rnam pas byas kyi don kyang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos can nyid du tha dad pa blo'i rnam pas byas kyi don kyang ni ma yin te /
translated: The difference of the property and the subject is made by the mind, but not by the object,

original: blo'i bye brag rang dga' ba rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i bye brag rang dga' ba rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the various minds that are independent are not the basis of the object.

original: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gyis don go na ni don mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gyis don go na ni don mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object designated by those were to be understood, then the meaning would be obtained only by designation.

original: 'bras bu yang rang bzhin dang 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rang bzhin dang 'brel pa yin te /
translated: And the effect is related to the nature,

original: de'i rang bzhin de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from that nature.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir der snang ba nyid ma yin yang /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir der snang ba nyid ma yin yang /
translated: These two cognitions of the object to be inferred do not appear as that, because they do not arise from that.

original: de las skyes pa'i phyir der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin te /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i phyir der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin te /
translated: But they are not mistaken with regard to that, because they arise from that.

original: des na mtshan ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: des na mtshan ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, they are valid cognitions, like direct perception.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang don 'khrul pa med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid kyang don 'khrul pa med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Direct perception is a valid cognition only when it is non-mistaken with regard to the object,

original: de med par 'byung ba ni der 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par 'byung ba ni der 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which arises without it is mistaken with regard to that.

original: gzhan gyi mi 'khrul pa yang de las skyes pa las gzhan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mi 'khrul pa yang de las skyes pa las gzhan ci zhig yod de /
translated: What else is there that is non-mistaken other than that which arises from it?

original: rag ma las pa'i ngo bo rnams ni lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rag ma las pa'i ngo bo rnams ni lhan cig 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things that are not related do not necessarily occur together.

original: gal te de las skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de las skye ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that it is a valid cognition because it arises from that,

original: 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin na rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu go bar byed pa yin na rnam pa thams cad du go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: If it is the effect that causes the understanding, then it is the nature of both that which is understood and that which understands in every way,

original: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because that which is produced and that which produces it exist in every way.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, they do not,

original: de med par 'byung ba ni de las skye ba nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par 'byung ba ni de las skye ba nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which arises without it does not definitely arise from it.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rgyu la rang bzhin ji snyed cig / med na mi 'byung 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rgyu la rang bzhin ji snyed cig / med na mi 'byung 'bras bu ni //
translated: if the cause lacks some nature, the effect does not arise.

original: de dag gi gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: That is the reason,

original: de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu nyid du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ascertained as its effect.

original: gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho nas yin no //
analyzed: gang dag de dag med na mi 'byung ba de dag kho nas yin no //
translated: That which does not arise without them is just those.

original: gal te cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te cha shas kyis bskyed par bya ba dang / skyed pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it follows that it is produced and produces by part,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that a part exists.

original: des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par dang / rtags kyi bye brag gi khyad par can gyi spyi rnams gzung na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par dang / rtags kyi bye brag gi khyad par can gyi spyi rnams gzung na yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that if one apprehends a universal that is qualified by a particular and a specific attribute, then it is produced by that.

original: spyi khyad par du ma byas pa brjod par 'dod na ni 'khrul pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
analyzed: spyi khyad par du ma byas pa brjod par 'dod na ni 'khrul pa'i phyir mi 'dod do //
translated: But if one wishes to express a universal without qualifying it, then it is not accepted because it would be erroneous.

original: rang bzhin yod tsam dang / 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo yang gtan tshigs yin zhes bya bar sbyar te /üîΩgtan tshigs kyi de'i bdag nyid ni de tsam dang 'brel pa @263a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod tsam dang / 'brel pa can gyi ngo bo yang gtan tshigs yin zhes bya bar sbyar te / gtan tshigs kyi de'i bdag nyid ni de tsam dang 'brel pa @263a * //
translated: The mere presence of an intrinsic nature and the nature of being related are also the reason.

original: can kho na'i phyir ro //
analyzed: can kho na'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the nature of the reason is merely that, and it is related to that alone.

original: gzhan la rag las pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not dependent on another,

original: de yod na yod par ma gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba ni nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yod par ma gyur pa'i phyis 'byung ba ni nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not certain that something that did not exist when it was present will arise later.

original: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtshad ma rnams ni mi 'jug pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rnams ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro // tshad ma rnams ni mi 'jug pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Causes are not certain because they can be erroneous with regard to their effect.üîΩThe non-apprehension of functioning is a valid means of knowledge.

original: med la mi 'jug 'bras bu can /
analyzed: med la mi 'jug 'bras bu can /
translated: It has the effect of not engaging with the non-existent.

original: yod pa'i shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin te /
analyzed: yod pa'i shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can yin te /
translated: The result of the negation of existence is the cognition of existence, the word existence, and the convention existence.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For these have a prior object.

original: 'di ni yod pa dang med pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi 'dra ba'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa dang med pa dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi 'dra ba'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: This is the similarity of the reason in the case of negation and in the case of affirmation.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For in this way, the nonexistence of the object is not.

original: dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po rung ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
translated: The existence of the object is the characteristic of a suitable entity,

original: yang na de'i rten can gyi shes pa 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na de'i rten can gyi shes pa 'jug pa yin te /
translated: or else it is the occurrence of the cognition that has that as its basis,

original: de las yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las yod pa'i shes pa dang sgra dang tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of existence, the word existence, and the convention existence occur from that.

original: mi dmigs pa ni med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no //
translated: Nonapprehension is the nonexistence of nonexistents.

original: gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bye brag la ltos nas //
translated: The reason depends on a particular.

original: la la med shes 'bras bu can //
analyzed: la la med shes 'bras bu can //
translated: Some have the result of the cognition of nonexistence.

original: gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reason is nonapprehension.

original: de'i bye brag ni khyad par te /
analyzed: de'i bye brag ni khyad par te /
translated: Its particular is a distinction.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir 'gyur ba'i yod pa can yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir 'gyur ba'i yod pa can yin no //
translated: It is the existence of that which has the characteristic of an object.

original: 'dir mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'dir mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: Here, if non-apprehension is the logical reason proving non-existence,

original: dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa yang mi dmigs pa gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya dgos pas thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then non-apprehension would not be a means of valid cognition, because non-apprehension would have to be established by another non-apprehension, and that would lead to an infinite regress.

original: 'on te dmigs pa med par yang mi dmigs par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'on te dmigs pa med par yang mi dmigs par 'gyur na ni /
translated: But if non-apprehension is established by non-apprehension,

original: de bzhin du yod pa med par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa med par yang 'gyur te /
translated: then existence would be established by non-existence,

original: mi dmigs pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa don med pa yin no //
translated: and non-apprehension would be meaningless.

original: ci ste gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pas mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub po zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dmigs pas mi dmigs pa 'grub pas mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis grub po zhe na /
translated: But if non-apprehension is established by the apprehension of another, then non-apprehension is established by direct perception.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yod pas kyang med pa ci ste mi 'grub /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yod pas kyang med pa ci ste mi 'grub /
translated: In the same way, why wouldn‚Äôt non-existence be established by the existence of another?

original: gang gi tshe med pa dag gi med pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe ni yul grub tu zin kyang rmongs pas yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dag khong du mi chud pa yul rab tu bstan pas brda la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe med pa dag gi med pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa kho na yin pa de'i tshe ni yul grub tu zin kyang rmongs pas yul can shes pa dang / sgra dang tha snyad dag khong du mi chud pa yul rab tu bstan pas brda la 'jug par byed de /
translated: When non-existence is only non-apprehension of such non-existence, then, even though the object is already established, the ignorant person does not understand the object, the cognition, the word, and the expression, and so the object is taught to him, and he is introduced to the convention.

original: dper na 'di ni ba lang yin te lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di ni ba lang yin te lkog shal la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúThis is a cow, because of the collection of dewlap and so on.‚Äù

original: de lta yin dang dpe ma grub @263b par rgol ba yang bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dpe ma grub @263b par rgol ba yang bsal ba yin no //
translated: If that were so, the example would not be established, and the opponent would be refuted.

original: yul rtogs su zin kyang yul can ma rtogs pa dag snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul rtogs su zin kyang yul can ma rtogs pa dag snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the object is understood, the subject is not understood, because of the appearance.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa 'di gnyis ni rang dang bzlog pa'i rgyu med pa dang / yod pa dag gi phyir yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa 'di gnyis ni rang dang bzlog pa'i rgyu med pa dang / yod pa dag gi phyir yod pa'i tha snyad dgag pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du 'dra ste /
translated: Thus, these two non-apprehensions are similar in that they have the effect of negating the expression of existence, because of the absence of the cause of the existence of the object and its opposite.

original: gcig la ni the tshom yod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gcig la ni the tshom yod pa'i phyir la /
translated: In one case, there is doubt,üîΩand in the other, there is no doubt.

original: gzhan la ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is the opposite of that.

original: de la dang po ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag par dgongs pa'i phyir tshad mar bshad kyi /
analyzed: de la dang po ni yod pa'i tha snyad dgag par dgongs pa'i phyir tshad mar bshad kyi /
translated: The first is explained as valid knowledge because it is intended to refute the convention of existence.

original: ldog pa mthong ba la sogs pa la nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa mthong ba la sogs pa la nye bar sbyor ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not applied to seeing the opposite, etc.,

original: the tshom yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt.

original: gnyis pa ni de la tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de la tshad ma yin te /
translated: The second is valid knowledge in that,

original: nges pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a definite result.

original: de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis //
translated: That is also by the distinction of application.üîΩThe four kinds of non-observation of the non-appearing

original: 'gal dang 'bras bu dag grub dang // rgyu dang ngo bor bltar rung ba'i //üîΩbdag nyid dag ni ma grub pa'i //
analyzed: 'gal dang 'bras bu dag grub dang // rgyu dang ngo bor bltar rung ba'i // bdag nyid dag ni ma grub pa'i //
translated: are established as contradictory, effect, cause, and nature.

original: med don can mi dmigs rnam bzhi //
analyzed: med don can mi dmigs rnam bzhi //
translated: The four kinds of non-observation of the non-appearingüîΩare non-establishment of the object of negation.

original: dgag pa gang ji snyed pa thams cad ni mi dmigs pas yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa gang ji snyed pa thams cad ni mi dmigs pas yin no //
translated: All negations are by non-observation.

original: 'di ltar de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis byed de /
translated: Thus, it is done in two ways:

original: 'ga' zhig sgrub pas sam /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig sgrub pas sam /
translated: by establishing something or

original: dgag pas so //üîΩbsgrubs na ni 'gal ba'am /
analyzed: dgag pas so // bsgrubs na ni 'gal ba'am /
translated: by negating.üîΩIf it is established, it is either established as contradictory

original: mi 'gal ba bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gal ba bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: or non-contradictory.

original: mi 'ga' ba bsgrubs na ni lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'ga' ba bsgrubs na ni lhan cig yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: But if one is establishing the nonexistence of something, then there is no contradiction in their co-existence, and so it is not refuted.

original: 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa med par 'gal ba mi rtogs te /
analyzed: 'gal ba yang mi dmigs pa med par 'gal ba mi rtogs te /
translated: And even if there is a contradiction, without the non-apprehension of something, the contradiction is not apprehended.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ma gtugs pa can 'byung ba gzhan yod na med pa'i 'gal bar rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ma gtugs pa can 'byung ba gzhan yod na med pa'i 'gal bar rtogs la /
translated: Thus, when the other, which is the cause of the non-apprehension, is present, the contradiction of non-existence is apprehended.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no //üîΩphan tshun dmigs pa spangs te /
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no // phan tshun dmigs pa spangs te /
translated: And that is due to the non-apprehension.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the contradictory is the mutual exclusion of the apprehension.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the contradiction of permanence and impermanence.

original: de la yang gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs pa kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: de la yang gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs pa kho nar brjod do //
translated: And in that case, it is said that by the apprehension of one, the other is necessarily not apprehended.

original: de lta ma yin na dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the apprehension were not excluded, the non-existence would not be established.

original: gcig bkag pas gzhan med par grub pa la ni mi dmigs pa grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gcig bkag pas gzhan med par grub pa la ni mi dmigs pa grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: But when the non-existence of one is established by the exclusion of the other, then the non-apprehension is established.

original: dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation is of the nature of non-apprehension.

original: don gzhan dgag pa de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam /
analyzed: don gzhan dgag pa de la yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam /
translated: And in that negation of the other object, the cause and effect are mutually exclusive.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa zhig yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa zhig yin te /
translated: It is neither.

original: de la gnyis ka ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gnyis ka ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: In that regard, the nonobservation of both is not related,

original: de med na gzhan med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na gzhan med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it does not exist, the other will not exist.

original: zhes bya ba der lta ga la 'gyur /üîΩ'bras bu @264a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der lta ga la 'gyur / 'bras bu @264a * //
translated: How could it be seen in that way?

original: mi dmigs kyang /
analyzed: mi dmigs kyang /
translated: Even though the effect is not observed,üîΩthe cause is not necessarily not endowed with it.

original: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin pas de med par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin pas de med par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be seen as not existing?

original: de'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na med pa go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mi dmigs pa kho na med pa go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nonobservation of the cause alone makes known nonexistence.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni rang med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The nonobservation of nature is only the nonexistence of itself.

original: de la ni yul can sgrub par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: de la ni yul can sgrub par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: In that regard, it is only the subject that is established.

original: 'di la yang gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba med par ston pa de'i tshe ni med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba med par ston pa de'i tshe ni med pa yang yin no //
translated: In this regard, when the nonobservation of a pervader demonstrates the absence of the pervaded, then it is nonexistence.

original: dgag pa'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: This nonobservation that has a negated object is of four types due to the differences in application.

original: 'gal ba grub pas ni dper na 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: 'gal ba grub pas ni dper na 'di ni grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: An example of an established contradiction is:

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is not a cold touch, because fire exists.

original: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya ste /
translated: By this, one should understand that the establishment of a contradictory pervasion is also explained.

original: dper na 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na ba mo'i reg pa med de /
translated: For example, this is not a cold touch,

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because fire exists.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu grub pas ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu grub pas ni /
translated: An example of an established contradictory effect is:

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i rig pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i rig pa med de du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is not a cold touch, because smoke exists.üîΩAn example of an unestablished cause is:

original: rgyu ma grub pas ni dper na 'di na du ba med de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma grub pas ni dper na 'di na du ba med de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is not smoke, because it does not exist.

original: rang bzhin ma grub pas ni dper na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma grub pas ni dper na /
translated: An example of an unestablished nature is:

original: 'di na du ba med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di na du ba med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: This is not smoke, because it is not observed.

original: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma grub pa yang bshad de /
analyzed: 'dis ni khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma grub pa yang bshad de /
translated: By this, one should understand that an unestablished pervading nature is also explained.

original: dper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di na shing sha pa med de shing med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no tree, because there is no ≈õim≈õapƒÅ tree.‚Äù

original: med pa sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag kho na de dag dang / 'gal pa grub pa dang ma grub par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: med pa sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid dag kho na de dag dang / 'gal pa grub pa dang ma grub par rig par bya ste /
translated: In all these cases of non-apprehension establishing non-existence, the object must be such that it can be apprehended, and the absence of the contradictory must be established.

original: gzhan dag la ni med pa dang 'gal ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni med pa dang 'gal ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For in other cases, non-existence and the absence of the contradictory are not established.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pas kyang med pa 'grub na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pas kyang med pa 'grub na /
translated: If non-existence is established by the apprehension of the effect of the contradictory,

original: de'i rgyu dmigs pas ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde dang 'gal ba'i rgyu mtshan ni //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dmigs pas ci ste 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na / de dang 'gal ba'i rgyu mtshan ni //
translated: why is it not established by the apprehension of the cause of the contradictory?üîΩThe reason is thatüîΩthe apprehension of the effect is the application of the reason

original: dmigs pa sbyor ba gang yin te //
analyzed: dmigs pa sbyor ba gang yin te //
translated: of the contradictory.

original: rgyu mtshan dag ni 'gal ba nyid //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dag ni 'gal ba nyid //
translated: The reason is contradictory

original: med na 'khrul pa can yin te //
analyzed: med na 'khrul pa can yin te //
translated: when the effect is absent, but it is fallaciousüîΩwhen the effect is present.

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de shing yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de shing yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch, because there is a tree.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal ba na ni go bar byed pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal ba na ni go bar byed pa kho na yin te /
translated: When the reason is contradictory, it is only an indicator.

original: dper na 'di na ba spu langs pa la sogs pa'i @264b khyad par med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na ba spu langs pa la sogs pa'i @264b khyad par med de /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúHere, there is no one with goosebumps, etc.,

original: me'i khyad par nye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: me'i khyad par nye ba can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because of being in the vicinity of a fire.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu las kyang de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i 'bras bu las kyang de dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu med par rtogs par bshad pa yin te /
translated: This explains that from the effect of that, one understands that there is no effect that is incompatible with it.

original: dper na phyogs 'di na ba spu langs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu can yin te /
analyzed: dper na phyogs 'di na ba spu langs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu can yin te /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúIn this place, there is someone with goosebumps, etc.,

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because there is smoke.‚Äù

original: de dang 'gal ba grub pa de yang gong du rgyu ma grub pa kho nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba grub pa de yang gong du rgyu ma grub pa kho nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: And the establishment of that which is incompatible with that is explained above, only by the non-establishment of the reason.

original: de ltar na mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar na mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: Thus, this non-apprehension is of eight types by the differences in the syllogism.

original: de la 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la /üîΩ'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
analyzed: de la 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa bshad pa gang yin pa de la / 'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
translated: Among them, that which was explained as the apprehension of an effect that is incompatible with it,üîΩin that,üîΩthe effect of incompatibility is also asserted to depend on the object,

original: dus la sogs la ltos par 'dod //
analyzed: dus la sogs la ltos par 'dod //
translated: time, etc.

original: gzhan du 'khrul 'gyur mi grang ba //
analyzed: gzhan du 'khrul 'gyur mi grang ba //
translated: Otherwise, there would be error, as in the case of the non-cold.

original: sgrub pa la ni thal ba bzhin //
analyzed: sgrub pa la ni thal ba bzhin //
translated: and the effect is produced as if it were a mere consequence.

original: 'o na rgyu tshogs pas 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum gyi nang du 'du zhe na /üîΩrgyu tshogs pa yis 'bras skye bar //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu tshogs pas 'bras bu skye bar rjes su dpog par byed pa gang yin pa de ji ltar gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum gyi nang du 'du zhe na / rgyu tshogs pa yis 'bras skye bar //
translated: But how can the inference of the production of the effect from the assemblage of causes be included in the three kinds of logical mark?üîΩThe inference of the production of the effect

original: rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa //üîΩdon gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa // don gzhan la ni mi ltos phyir //
translated: from the assemblage of causesüîΩis called natural,

original: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin yin par brjod //
translated: because it does not depend on another object.

original: 'di yang ji ltar nye ba las gzhan la mi ltos te /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar nye ba las gzhan la mi ltos te /
translated: And how does it not depend on another?

original: des na ngo bo'i de tsam dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: des na ngo bo'i de tsam dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a natural relation of the mere entity to that.

original: de la ni rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu skye bar srid pa rjes su dpog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
analyzed: de la ni rgyu tshogs pa las 'bras bu skye bar srid pa rjes su dpog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de /
translated: In this case, the mere possibility of the production of the effect from the assemblage of causes is inferred.

original: tshogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu bskyed par rung ba nyid rjes su dpog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fitness of the assemblage to produce the effect is inferred.

original: rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa tsam dang 'brel pas rang bzhin du 'gyur ba kho na rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyang tshogs pa tsam dang 'brel pas rang bzhin du 'gyur ba kho na rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: And the fitness is inferred to be a natural relation with the mere assemblage.

original: yang ci'i phyir tshogs pa las 'bras bu kho na rjes su dpog par mi byed ce na /üîΩtshogs pa'i 'bras bu nus pa na //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir tshogs pa las 'bras bu kho na rjes su dpog par mi byed ce na / tshogs pa'i 'bras bu nus pa na //
translated: Why is it that one does not infer the effect from the assemblage?

original: 'gyur ba dang 'brel 'bras bu la //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dang 'brel 'bras bu la //
translated: The effect of the assemblage is a transformation of the potential.

original: ma nges pa ni nyid yin te //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni nyid yin te //
translated: The effect is not ascertained because

original: gags byed pa dag srid phyir ro //
analyzed: gags byed pa dag srid phyir ro //
translated: an obstruction is possible.

original: rgyu'i rjes tshogs pa dag kho nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i rjes tshogs pa dag kho nas rang gi 'bras bu skyed par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The assemblage of causes does not produce its effect by itself.

original: 'bras bu skye ba ni tshogs pa las skye ba can gyi nus pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skye ba ni tshogs pa las skye ba can gyi nus pa rnams kyi 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The production of the effect depends on a transformation of the potentials that are produced from the assemblage.

original: bar 'dir gags byed pa srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar 'dir gags byed pa srid pa'i phyir 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: The effect is not inferred because an obstruction is possible in the interim.

original: rung ba nyid ni rdzas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rung ba nyid ni rdzas gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the suitability does not depend on another substance,

original: rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba med do //üîΩnus pa phyi ma phyi ma 'gyur bas rgyu @265a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la 'gal ba med do // nus pa phyi ma phyi ma 'gyur bas rgyu @265a * //
translated: there is no contradiction in the inference.üîΩThe assemblage of causes is capable of producing the effect because

original: tshogs pa 'di 'bras bu bskyed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa 'di 'bras bu bskyed par nus pa yin te /
translated: the subsequent potentials are transformed.

original: nus pa 'gyur ba'i rkyen gzhan la ltos par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa 'gyur ba'i rkyen gzhan la ltos par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not depend on other conditions for the transformation of its potency.

original: nus pa skye ba ni rang gi rigs snga ma tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa skye ba ni rang gi rigs snga ma tsam gyi rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The arising of the potency is due only to the prior homogeneous cause.

original: tshogs pa'i rung ba nyid ni gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i rung ba nyid ni gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The suitability of the collection is called ‚Äúnot depending on another.‚Äù

original: 'o na rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa gzhan ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa gzhan ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa gang yin pa de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that form, etc., is cognized by another, such as taste, which is not its effect?

original: de yang // tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pa'i //
analyzed: de yang // tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pa'i //
translated: That is,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ros rtogs pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ros rtogs pa //
translated: form, etc., is cognized by taste,üîΩwhich is dependent on the same collection,

original: rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag pas te //
analyzed: rgyu'i chos rjes su dpag pas te //
translated: by inferring the cause of the property.

original: du bas bud shing 'gyur ba bzhin //
analyzed: du bas bud shing 'gyur ba bzhin //
translated: It is like the transformation of fuel by smoke.

original: de la ni rgyu de lta bu kho na rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: de la ni rgyu de lta bu kho na rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: In that case, one infers just such a cause.

original: ro'i rgyu de lta bu ni gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu nus la zhugs pa can gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing ro skyed par byed de /
analyzed: ro'i rgyu de lta bu ni gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu nus la zhugs pa can gyi lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing ro skyed par byed de /
translated: Such a cause of taste is the cooperative condition that is the cause of the appropriation of form, which is engaged in the cause of arising, and it produces taste.

original: me bud shing 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing du ba bskyed pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: me bud shing 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhing du ba bskyed pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The fire is the condition of the cause of the appropriation of the transformation of the fuel, just as it is the producer of the smoke.

original: 'di ltar nus pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: In this way, the power is applied.

original: rang gi rgyu'i 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la mngon du phyogs pa med par ni /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba la mngon du phyogs pa med par ni /
translated: Without the absence of the effect of its cause, which is directed toward the production of its effect,

original: ro med de nyid gzhan gyi rgyu //
analyzed: ro med de nyid gzhan gyi rgyu //
translated: the power is not the cause of the other.

original: gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the appropriation of the form is the cause of the application of the power.

original: ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa de yang gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa can yin te /
analyzed: ro'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa de yang gzugs kyi nye bar len pa'i rgyu 'jug pa'i lhan cig byed pa can yin te /
translated: The application of the cause of the appropriation of the taste is the co-operating cause of the application of the cause of the appropriation of the form.

original: de'i phyir rgyu ji lta bu las byung ba'i ros de lta bu rjes su dpog par byed pa na gzugs rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu ji lta bu las byung ba'i ros de lta bu rjes su dpog par byed pa na gzugs rjes su dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the power infers the form in accordance with the kind of cause from which it arises, it infers the taste.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: In this regard,

original: de ltar 'das dus gcig rnams rtogs kyi ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'das dus gcig rnams rtogs kyi ma 'ongs pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: in this way, the past is understood, but not the future,

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of error.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes //
translated: It is born from the effect as reason.

original: de'i phyir go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan ni med de rang bzhin ma 'brel pa ni med na mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs gzhan ni med de rang bzhin ma 'brel pa ni med na mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no other reason that is a proof, because the nature of non-connection is not ascertained as non-arising.

original: 'dis ni grog ma 'pho ba dang / nya 'phar ba la sogs pa las char pa la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni grog ma 'pho ba dang / nya 'phar ba la sogs pa las char pa la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
translated: This also explains the inference of rain, etc. from the movement of ants, the jumping of fish, and so on.

original: de la yang char pa'i rgyu 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na grog ma la sogs pa 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩrgyu ma tshogs pas 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: de la yang char pa'i rgyu 'byung bar 'gyur ba kho na grog ma la sogs pa 'khrug pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin no // rgyu ma tshogs pas 'bras bu ni //
translated: In that case, only the occurrence of the cause of rain is the cause of the agitation of ants, etc.

original: rjes su dpog pa gang yin de //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa gang yin de //
translated: The effect that is inferred from the incomplete causeüîΩis like the inference of desire from the body.

original: lhag ma dang ldan @265b nus med phyir //
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan @265b nus med phyir //
translated: Because it is not possible when incomplete,

original: lus las 'dod chags rjes dpog bzhin //
analyzed: lus las 'dod chags rjes dpog bzhin //
translated: it is like the inference of desire from the body.

original: rung ba nyid kyang rgyu tshogs pa dag kho nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyang rgyu tshogs pa dag kho nas rjes su dpog par byed de /
translated: Suitability is also inferred only from the assembly of causes.

original: ma tshogs pa la shin tu nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma tshogs pa la shin tu nus pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not possible when incomplete, it is like the inference of desire from the body.

original: dper na lus dbang po dang blo dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lus dbang po dang blo dag las 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like inferring desire, etc. from the body and the mind.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bdag dang bdag gir zhen pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: Desire, etc. are preceded by the adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: nyes pa thams cad skye ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad skye ba'i sngon du 'gro ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the cause of all faults is the improper mental attention.

original: lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid ni yin mod kyi 'ba' zhig pa rnams la ni nus pa med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa'i phyir /üîΩthe tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa rgyu nyid ni yin mod kyi 'ba' zhig pa rnams la ni nus pa med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa ma mthong du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan pa'i phyir / the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: The body, etc. are indeed the cause, but they are not capable of acting alone, so even though one does not see them operating in the absence of the adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù one should be in doubt about this, because the remainder of the inference is still to be completed.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba //
translated: one should be in doubt about the absence of desire, etc.üîΩfrom the absence of the adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: tsam gyi 'bras spyi mthong ba las //
analyzed: tsam gyi 'bras spyi mthong ba las //
translated: because one does not see the cause of desire, etc.üîΩin the absence of the adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs shes pa tshad ltar snang //
analyzed: gtan tshigs shes pa tshad ltar snang //
translated: One should be in doubt about the absence of desire, etc.üîΩfrom the absence of the adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: tshig las chags can la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: tshig las chags can la sogs bzhin //
translated: because one does not see the cause of desire, etc.üîΩin the absence of the adherence to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: g-yo ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kho na'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang tshig la sogs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa kho na'i 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Movement, speech, etc. are not just the results of attachment, etc.

original: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa spyi'i rgyu can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the general causes of what is desired.

original: gal te de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that just that is attachment,

original: 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: there is no harm at all because it is desired.

original: 'dod chags ni sems kyi mngon par zhen pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gir lta bas 'phangs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can yin par smra'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni sems kyi mngon par zhen pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag dang bdag gir lta bas 'phangs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos kyi yul can yin par smra'o //
translated: We maintain that attachment is the mental adherence to permanence, pleasure, self, and possession, and is the cause of the object of contaminated things.

original: snying rje la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: snying rje la sogs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Compassion, etc. are not like that,

original: gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: because they are possible in other ways.

original: ji ltar chags pa smra ba ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de dang 'dra bas tshig tsam las mi rtogs so //
analyzed: ji ltar chags pa smra ba ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba yang de dang 'dra bas tshig tsam las mi rtogs so //
translated: Since the detached are like the attached in speech, nothing is understood from mere words.

original: khyad par las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it from the distinctive feature,

original: bsam pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir /
translated: because the intention is difficult to understand.

original: tha snyad 'chol bas thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad 'chol bas thams cad 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the confusion of all due to the confusion of the conventional.

original: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi smra'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dgos pa med pa'i phyir mi smra'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not spoken of because it is useless,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: gzhan gyi yod yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yod yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the existence of another.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not reasonable because of being free from passion,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snying rjes kyang 'jug pa'i phyir ro // ci ste de nyid 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
translated: because it is also engaged through compassion.üîΩIf you say that it is passion itself,

original: 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa las byung ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: because there is no fault, since it arises from non-error.

original: @266a * // snying rje ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong tsam gyis goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin te /
analyzed: @266a * // snying rje ni bdag tu 'dzin pa med kyang sdug bsngal gyi khyad par mthong tsam gyis goms pa'i stobs las skye ba yin te /
translated: Compassion arises from the power of habituation, merely through seeing the particular suffering, even without the apprehension of self.

original: 'di ltar byams pa la sogs pa ni sems can dang chos la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar byams pa la sogs pa ni sems can dang chos la sogs pa la dmigs pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, it is accepted that love and so forth have sentient beings and phenomena as their objects.

original: de dag kyang rigs mthun pa la goms pas 'byung ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag kyang rigs mthun pa la goms pas 'byung ba can yin gyi /
translated: And they arise from the power of habituation to similar types,

original: 'dod chags la ltos pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la ltos pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from the power of passion.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so for desire, etc.

original: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For they do not exist when there is no error.

original: gal te snying rje can gyi rtsom pa 'bras bu med pa yang phyin ci log las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snying rje can gyi rtsom pa 'bras bu med pa yang phyin ci log las yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the undertaking of the compassionate one is fruitless because of error,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: gzhan gyi don kho na 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don kho na 'bras bu nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the benefit of others is accepted as the fruit.

original: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the definition of fruit is that which is desired.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because there is no superimposition of what is totally non-existent.

original: de las gzhan pas nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du bsgrubs na ni mi 'dod pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pas nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid du bsgrubs na ni mi 'dod pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: If you prove that he is at fault in some other way, there is nothing undesirable in this.

original: smra ba po bdag la 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong bas gzhan la de rjes su dpog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smra ba po bdag la 'dod chags la sogs pa mthong bas gzhan la de rjes su dpog na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you infer the existence of desire, etc. in others from seeing it in yourself, the speaker, there is an overextension of the rule.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir gzhan rjes su mi dpog na ni 'di la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir gzhan rjes su mi dpog na ni 'di la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
translated: If you do not infer it in others because of error, what is the certainty that there is no error in this case?

original: tshig gis ni byed pa'i yon tan dang brjod pas 'dod pa nyid dag rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: tshig gis ni byed pa'i yon tan dang brjod pas 'dod pa nyid dag rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: The presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.üîΩThe absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.üîΩThe presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.

original: 'dod chags bskyed par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la smra ba ma mthong ba'i phyir /üîΩde rjes su dpog na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dod chags bskyed par rung ba nyid dang bral ba la smra ba ma mthong ba'i phyir / de rjes su dpog na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.üîΩThe presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.

original: 'dod chags kyis phan mi 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis phan mi 'dogs na ni /
translated: The absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.

original: ji ltar de'i nus pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur /üîΩnus pas phan 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i nus pas phan 'dogs par 'gyur / nus pas phan 'dogs na ni /
translated: The presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.üîΩThe absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.

original: de nyid kyis phan btags par 'gyur ba zhig na /üîΩde ni med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis phan btags par 'gyur ba zhig na / de ni med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: The presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.üîΩThe absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.üîΩThe presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.

original: de lta bas na med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho nas rgyu rjes su dpog par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na med na mi 'byung ba'i 'bras bu kho nas rgyu rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: The absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.

original: de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rag las pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.

original: gzhan ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yang ma yin no //üîΩthams cad gzigs pa'i gzigs pa log pas ni /
analyzed: gzhan ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yang ma yin no // thams cad gzigs pa'i gzigs pa log pas ni /
translated: The absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.üîΩThe presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.üîΩThe absence of the cause is inferred from the absence of the effect, and the absence of the effect is inferred from the absence of the cause.üîΩThe presence of the cause is inferred from the presence of the effect, and the presence of the effect is inferred from the presence of the cause.

original: thams cad na med pa go bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad na med pa go bar byed do //
translated: The absence

original: la la na de ltar mthong ba rnams kyang dus dang 'du bya ba'i khyad par las gzhan du snang pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: la la na de ltar mthong ba rnams kyang dus dang 'du bya ba'i khyad par las gzhan du snang pa'i phyir te /
translated: Some say: Even those who see it that way, it appears otherwise due to the difference of time and the particular action.

original: dper na sgyu ru ra'i shing dag @266b 'o mas bcus na 'bras bu mngar po chags la /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ru ra'i shing dag @266b 'o mas bcus na 'bras bu mngar po chags la /
translated: For example, if a sugarcane plant is watered, a sweet fruit grows.

original: phal cher ni de ltar mi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: phal cher ni de ltar mi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: But for the most part, it does not appear that way.

original: des na 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du bdag lta bu'i smra ba po ni 'dod chags can yin no zhes brjod par rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say, ‚ÄúA speaker like me is desirous,‚Äù

original: 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen gyi khyad par bdag tu lta ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags skye ba'i rkyen gyi khyad par bdag tu lta ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he possesses the special conditions for the arising of desire: the view of self and improper mental activity.

original: de'i tshe yang smra ba dpe brjod pa ni don med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang smra ba dpe brjod pa ni don med de /
translated: Even then, the example of the speaker is pointless.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, not seeing in the discordant side is not suitable as a reason.

original: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la ma mthong ba //
translated: Not seeing in the discordant side

original: tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min //
analyzed: tsam gyis 'khrul pa med pa min //
translated: is not nonerroneous due to mere nonobservation.

original: 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid phyir //
analyzed: 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid phyir //
translated: Because error is possible,

original: phru ba'i 'bras ni tshos pa bzhin //
analyzed: phru ba'i 'bras ni tshos pa bzhin //
translated: The rice in the pot is like the cooked rice.

original: mang po zhig tshos pa mthong du zin kyang phru ba'i nang du 'dug pa tsam gyis tshos par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: mang po zhig tshos pa mthong du zin kyang phru ba'i nang du 'dug pa tsam gyis tshos par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even though one sees many grains of rice that are cooked, one does not conclude that the rice in the pot is cooked merely because of the rice that is in the pot.

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees the error.

original: 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin la /
translated: In this way, in the case of this kind of nature,

original: 'di dang tshogs pa'i rgyu 'dra ba can dag ni tshos so zhes bya bar ni rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di dang tshogs pa'i rgyu 'dra ba can dag ni tshos so zhes bya bar ni rung ngo //
translated: it is proper to say that the rice in the pot is cooked because the cause of the cooked rice is similar to the cooked rice that is seen.

original: de lta ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa de lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: If it were not so, then the inference would be erroneous because it would be incomplete.

original: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /üîΩgang zhig ma mthong ba tsam gyis //
analyzed: yang lhag ma dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na / gang zhig ma mthong ba tsam gyis //
translated: What is this that is called incomplete?üîΩThat which is taught to be reversed

original: ldog pa rab tu ston byed pa //
analyzed: ldog pa rab tu ston byed pa //
translated: merely on the ground of non-perception,

original: de ni the tshom rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: de ni the tshom rgyu yin phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of doubt,

original: de la lhag ma ldan zhes brjod //
analyzed: de la lhag ma ldan zhes brjod //
translated: is said to be incomplete.

original: de'i ldog pa de ni ma nges pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ldog pa de ni ma nges pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug par the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because the reversal of that is uncertain, one doubts that it occurs in the discordant side.

original: ldog pa sgrub pa ma mthong ba tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa sgrub pa ma mthong ba tsam ni the tshom gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere non-seeing of the reversal of the probandum is a cause of doubt.

original: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Not all non-apprehension is a means of knowing.

original: de'i phyir gcig log pas gzhan ldog par 'dod pas ni de gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig log pas gzhan ldog par 'dod pas ni de gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa 'ga' zhig kyang 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one who asserts that the reversal of one thing is the reversal of another must also assert that the two are related in some way.

original: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the reason would not be a means of knowing.

original: gtan tshigs kyi ni tshul gsum la'ang //üîΩde yis ma grub bzlog don dang // 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi ni tshul gsum la'ang // de yis ma grub bzlog don dang // 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni //
translated: The three modes of the reasonüîΩare stated for the sake of refutingüîΩthe unestablished, the opposite meaning,

original: nges pa brjod par mdzad pa yin //
analyzed: nges pa brjod par mdzad pa yin //
translated: and the mistaken.

original: 'brel pa med par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa med de /
translated: There is no invariable concomitance of pervasion and reversal without a relation.

original: des na de nyid ston par mdzad pa ni nges pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid ston par mdzad pa ni nges pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement of the ascertainment is the teaching of that itself.

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams bsal @267a * //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa rnams bsal @267a * //
translated: Therein, by the ascertainment of pervasion, the contradictory and its counterparts are excluded.

original: lo // ldog pas ni ma nges pa dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa lhag ma dang ldan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo // ldog pas ni ma nges pa dang de'i phyogs dang mthun pa lhag ma dang ldan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúother‚Äù is the uncertain and the remaining that are in accord with it.

original: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni gcig la grub pa dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni gcig la grub pa dgag pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Both‚Äù is the negation of the established in one.

original: rab tu grub pa zhes smos pas mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la lhag ma dang ldan pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i the tshom za ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa zhes smos pas mthun pa'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la lhag ma dang ldan pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i the tshom za ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: Since it is said to be ‚Äúwell established,‚Äù it is the remaining that are in accord with the similar class and the uncommon that are in doubt.

original: de lta ma yin te 'brel pa med par ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te 'brel pa med par ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na ni /
translated: Otherwise, if there were mere non-seeing without a connection,üîΩthen the opponent would say,üîΩ‚ÄúThe expression of a dissimilar property

original: 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni //üîΩmi mthun chos brjod gang yin pa //üîΩre zhig 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs so zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa can gyi gnyen por ni // mi mthun chos brjod gang yin pa // re zhig 'gal ba dang ma nges pa'i gnyen por gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs so zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: is the antidote to error.üîΩThis is the expression of both that is to be stated as the antidote to contradiction and uncertainty.

original: chos mi mthun pa smos pa ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa smos pa ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The expression of a dissimilar property is the antidote to uncertainty.

original: gal te ma mthong 'bras can te /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong 'bras can te /
translated: If there is a result from non-seeing,üîΩthen there is no result from seeing.

original: gal te des mi mthun pa'i chos la ma mthong ba ston par byed na /
analyzed: gal te des mi mthun pa'i chos la ma mthong ba ston par byed na /
