translated: If it shows the non-seeing of a contradictory property,

original: de ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: then it is understood even without being stated.

original: de la sngon brjod pas log par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do //
analyzed: de la sngon brjod pas log par 'gyur ba mthong ba'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa ni med do //
translated: There is no error in the statement being reversed, as was previously stated.

original: gal te tshig gis ma mthong ba la dran par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshig gis ma mthong ba la dran par byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the non-seeing is remembered by the word,

original: mthong ba ma rtogs pa ni yan lag ma yin pas de la ni dran pa gzhag par rigs na /
analyzed: mthong ba ma rtogs pa ni yan lag ma yin pas de la ni dran pa gzhag par rigs na /
translated: since the non-realization of seeing is not a part, it is reasonable to posit memory there.

original: ma mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba ni mthong ba med pa yin te /
translated: But the non-seeing is the absence of seeing.

original: de la ni mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ni mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, it is contradicted by seeing.

original: de med na grub pa kho na yin pas de grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa don med do //
analyzed: de med na grub pa kho na yin pas de grub par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa don med do //
translated: If it does not exist, it is established, so stating it for the sake of establishing it is pointless.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa'i tshe de tsam gyis med do zhes bya ba ma yin pas de'i phyir brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa'i tshe de tsam gyis med do zhes bya ba ma yin pas de'i phyir brjod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that when there is non-apprehension, it is not the case that it is non-existent merely by that, and therefore it is stated,

original: med ces bya ba'i tshig gis kyang //
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i tshig gis kyang //
translated: then by the word non-existent,

original: de med kho na min gal te //
analyzed: de med kho na min gal te //
translated: if it is not just the absence of that,

original: ji ltar med rigs de brjod na //
analyzed: ji ltar med rigs de brjod na //
translated: then how is it reasonable to say it is non-existent?

original: de tshe med ces bya bar rtogs //
analyzed: de tshe med ces bya bar rtogs //
translated: Then it is understood that it does not exist.

original: gal te ma dmigs pas med do ces bya bar mi rtogs na brjod pas kyang mi rtogs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs pas med do ces bya bar mi rtogs na brjod pas kyang mi rtogs pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If one does not understand that something does not exist because it is not perceived, then one will not understand it even if it is stated.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa kho na rjod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa kho na rjod par byed pa yin no //
translated: For, it is only non-perception that states it.

original: gcig ma dmigs pas ni gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig ma dmigs pas ni gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the non-perception of one thing establish the non-existence of another,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: des med do zhes brjod pas kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des med do zhes brjod pas kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the statement ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù lead to that conclusion,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de bas na ji ltar chos mi mthun pa smos pas ma nges pa spangs pa yin /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar chos mi mthun pa smos pas ma nges pa spangs pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how can the statement of a dissimilar instance avoid being inconclusive?

original: de lta bas na ldog par 'dod @267b pas de la gang gis na 'di la ldog pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na ldog par 'dod @267b pas de la gang gis na 'di la ldog pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i rigs pa brjod dgos so //
translated: Thus, one who wishes to refute by means of an exclusion must state the reason that would make this an exclusion.

original: de med pa la mi dmigs pas ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa la mi dmigs pas ldog pa grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is not the exclusion established by the non-perception of the absent thing?

original: gal te ma mthong bas ldog 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas ldog 'gyur //
translated: If the exclusion is due to non-perception,

original: ci ste lhag ldan 'khrul can yin //
analyzed: ci ste lhag ldan 'khrul can yin //
translated: If it is mistaken because it has a remainder,

original: dper na 'bras bu 'di dag ni smin pa'am ro 'di bro ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu 'di dag ni smin pa'am ro 'di bro ba yin te /
translated: for example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThese fruits are ripe or this taste is sweet,

original: gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gzugs khyad par med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because the form is indistinguishable,

original: gcig las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: or because they are produced from one thing.‚Äù

original: zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zos pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like eating.üîΩHere, if the entire intended meaning is taken as the subject, the non-observation of the reason exists in the absence of the probandum. So how is it mistaken?

original: 'di la yang brjod par 'dod pa ma lus pa phyogs su byas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa yod pas ji ltar 'khrul pa yin kha cig na re mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro
analyzed: 'di la yang brjod par 'dod pa ma lus pa phyogs su byas na bsgrub par bya ba med pa la gtan tshigs mi dmigs pa yod pas ji ltar 'khrul pa yin kha cig na re mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa'i 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro
translated: Some say: It is mistaken because it is suspected of being contradicted by perception.

original: // ma yin te phyogs su byas pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // ma yin te phyogs su byas pa'i yul la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it does not exist in the domain of the subject.

original: ci ste gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say: ‚ÄúIf it is not, it is mistaken,‚Äù

original: de lta bus dgos na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bus dgos na ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: if that is the purpose, it is absurd,

original: gzhan la yang med bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang med bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no certainty that it does not exist elsewhere.

original: tshad ma zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma zhugs pa gnod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: A valid cognition that engages its object is what contradicts it.

original: ma zhugs par gnod na ni thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
analyzed: ma zhugs par gnod na ni thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
translated: If it is harmful to not enter, then there is no confidence in anything.

original: ldog pa ni grub pa kho na bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa ni grub pa kho na bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: The reversal is established only when the proof is established.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo ni nges pa la ltos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo ni nges pa la ltos so //
translated: Therefore, such a nature depends on certainty.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni 'ga' zhig la med pa grub tu zin kyang 'brel pa med pa ni de med kyang thams cad la med pa mi grub pas /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas ni 'ga' zhig la med pa grub tu zin kyang 'brel pa med pa ni de med kyang thams cad la med pa mi grub pas /
translated: By way of non-apprehension, even if non-existence is established for some, without a connection, even if it does not exist, non-existence in everything is not established.

original: the tshom za ba'i phyir ldog pa med pa ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba'i phyir ldog pa med pa ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of doubt, the reversal is a mistake with a remainder.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / ldog pa can yang gtan tshigs 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ldog pa can yang gtan tshigs 'gyur //
translated: the reversal is also a reason.

original: gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa na yin te /üîΩsrog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gson po'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa na yin te / srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This living body is without a self,üîΩbecause of the consequence of being both possessed and not possessed of life, and so on.

original: bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la srog la sogs pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because life, and so on, are not seen in the seen and unseen pots, and so on, which are without a self.

original: de las ldog pas bdag yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ldog pas bdag yod par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is understood to exist in the opposite way.

original: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas med pa ma grub na /
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba mi dmigs pas med pa ma grub na /
translated: If non-apprehension of the imperceptible does not establish non-existence,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa ldog pa med do //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ma grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa ldog pa med do //
translated: then the absence of life, etc. is not established, because the absence of self in a pot, etc. is not established.

original: gal te khas blangs pa'i phyir 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa'i phyir 'grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is established by assertion,

original: da ni ji ltar na bdag 'grub /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na bdag 'grub /
translated: then how is the self established?

original: gzhan bdag med pa tshad ma ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'grub par @268a * //
analyzed: gzhan bdag med pa tshad ma ma yin pa yang ji ltar 'grub par @268a * //
translated: And how is the non-self of others established, if it is not a valid cognition?

original: 'gyur ; khas blangs pas ni bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dag rnam par phye nas de la med pas rtogs par byed pa nyid yin par rjod par byed pas kyang /
analyzed: 'gyur ; khas blangs pas ni bdag dang bcas pa dang / bdag med pa dag rnam par phye nas de la med pas rtogs par byed pa nyid yin par rjod par byed pas kyang /
translated: By asserting that the self and the non-self are distinguished, and that the self is understood by the absence of the non-self,

original: bdag lung las byung ba nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bdag lung las byung ba nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: you are saying that the self is accepted as existing,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not to be inferred.

original: de lta bas na ma mthong du zin kyang bdag ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma mthong du zin kyang bdag ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, even though it is not seen, the absence of the self is not established.

original: 'ga' zhig la de log ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la de log ste /
translated: For some, the absence of the self is established by the absence of the object of the view of the self.

original: srog la sogs pa log kyang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa log kyang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because even if life, etc., were reversed, there would be no connection.

original: thams cad las ldog pa mi 'grub pas rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad las ldog pa mi 'grub pas rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is not established that all are reversed, it is not a proof.

original: gang yang ma grub pa'i sbyor ba de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa /
analyzed: gang yang ma grub pa'i sbyor ba de bzhin du mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa /
translated: And just as the nonestablishment of the reason is stated, so too the presence and absence in similar instances, etc., should be stated as appropriate.

original: ma grub sbyar ba de yang brjod bya min //
analyzed: ma grub sbyar ba de yang brjod bya min //
translated: That nonestablishment of the reason is also not to be stated.

original: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is doubt only in the case of nonapprehension.

original: dmigs na de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs na de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were apprehension, there would be nonexistence.

original: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ldog go zhes byas na the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i phyir ldog go zhes byas na the tshom du gyur pa yang ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is said that there is reversal because there is nonapprehension, then doubt would not be reversed.

original: gal te ci rigs par zhes smos pa phyir ma ldog pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gal te ci rigs par zhes smos pa phyir ma ldog pa kho na yin no //
translated: If it is said that it is not reversed because of the phrase ‚Äúas appropriate,‚Äù

original: zhe na / ci yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / ci yin te /
translated: what is the point?

original: brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa gang zhig gnyi ga la nges pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the statement ‚Äúonly in both cases‚Äù occurs.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas ldog pa med par dgos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas ldog pa med par dgos te /
translated: Therefore, even though there is no perception, there is no reversal because of doubt.

original: de dgag par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dgag par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained as the refutation of that.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / khyad par rnam par gcod pa yi //üîΩgtan tshigs su 'gyur ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyad par rnam par gcod pa yi // gtan tshigs su 'gyur ma mthong phyir //
translated: The reason is the exclusion of the distinction,üîΩbecause it is not seen.

original: mnyam par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir ldog pas /
analyzed: mnyam par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i phyir ldog pas /
translated: The equality itself is also reversed because it is not seen in the permanent and impermanent.

original: de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it becomes the very reason for the exclusion of those.

original: rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las ldog pa las gzhan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ni de dag las ldog pa las gzhan pa yin no //
translated: Exclusion is different from the reversal of those.

original: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni gang las kyang log pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni gang las kyang log pa nyid du ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-exclusion is not ascertained as the reversal from anything.

original: gang zhig gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de yod na ji ltar de med par rtogs par mi byed de /üîΩgal te tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de yod na ji ltar de med par rtogs par mi byed de / gal te tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod //
translated: When it is ascertained that something does not exist in something, how could it not be understood that it does not exist there?üîΩIf it is harmed by another valid cognition,

original: ci ste gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa yin na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do //
analyzed: ci ste gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa yin na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do //
translated: If both are excluded, there is another valid cognition that harms.

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can rnams ni gcig rnam @268b par gcod pas gzhan sgrub pa'i phyir dgag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo can rnams ni gcig rnam @268b par gcod pas gzhan sgrub pa'i phyir dgag pa ma yin te /
translated: But when things are mutually exclusive, one is affirmed by the exclusion of the other.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag ni 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the negation is not an affirmation, because affirmation and negation are contradictory.

original: da ni ma mthong las med min //
analyzed: da ni ma mthong las med min //
translated: Now, nonexistence is not due to nonperception.

original: de ltar na ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na ma mthong ba ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Thus, nonperception is not a means of valid cognition,

original: gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to be harmed.

original: de bzhin du ni gzhan la yang //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzhan la yang //
translated: And so it is with the others.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid //
translated: It is possible to be harmed by another means of valid cognition.

original: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na /
translated: If it is possible to be harmed by one that possesses the characteristics of a means of valid cognition,

original: de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung ba kho nar 'gyur bas thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo //
translated: then the characteristics of that means of valid cognition are refuted. Therefore, one cannot rely on any means of valid cognition.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong bas yid brten du mi rung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong bas yid brten du mi rung bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is possible to be harmed by another means of valid cognition, then it follows, absurdly, that one cannot rely on inference either, because one can see that the object of inference is contradicted by perception and inference.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it does not,

original: ji skad bshad pa lta bu la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa lta bu la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for the object of inference to be as it is described.

original: srid na ni de'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srid na ni de'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it does exist, then it is not the characteristic of that.

original: gal te 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can gyi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can gyi brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said that there is a contradiction, because there is no error,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma brjod pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la ma brjod pa'i phyir 'dod pa yin te /
translated: we accept that, because the object of inference is not stated.

original: 'di'i yul ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yul ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: But its object should be stated.üîΩMoreover:üîΩBecause of not seeing, seeing contact,

original: gzhan yang / ma mthong phyir reg mthong ba dang // mi ldan 'khrul pa med pa can //
analyzed: gzhan yang / ma mthong phyir reg mthong ba dang // mi ldan 'khrul pa med pa can //
translated: without possession, without error.

original: gal te mi dmigs pas ldog pa 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pas ldog pa 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If the negation is established by non-apprehension,

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mchod pa la las 'gog par byed na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mchod pa la las 'gog par byed na /
translated: if the negation of the object is made by mere non-seeing,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gang bshad pa ji ltar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is not reasonable, as was explained. How is it not reasonable?

original: mi dmigs pas med pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas med pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-apprehension establishes non-existence.

original: reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dgag pa rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa dgag pa rigs pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it not reasonable to negate contact, which has the characteristic of being apprehended?

original: rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable.

original: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin gyi yul tsam la 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang de'i rang bzhin gyi yul tsam la 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a negation of mere appearance and the object that is its nature.

original: des ni sa la sogs pa spyir bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
analyzed: des ni sa la sogs pa spyir bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
translated: He has stated a negation by taking earth, etc., in a general sense.

original: de la shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa la de yod kyang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shing bal dang rdo ba dang lo ma la sogs pa la de yod kyang reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, although it exists in cotton, stone, leaves, etc., a different tactility is seen.

original: 'di yang khyad par 'ga' zhig la srid par dgos par 'gyur bas thams cad la ni mthong bas dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang khyad par 'ga' zhig la srid par dgos par 'gyur bas thams cad la ni mthong bas dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And this is possible in some particular case, so it is not reasonable to negate it in all cases by perception.

original: de ltar na slob dpon mi dmigs pas med pa smra ba 'ga' zhig gis klan ka btsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na slob dpon mi dmigs pas med pa smra ba 'ga' zhig gis klan ka btsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the Master has been accused by some who are nihilists because of non-apprehension.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / yul la sogs pa'i khyad par las //
analyzed: gzhan yang / yul la sogs pa'i khyad par las //
translated: from the particularity of the object, etc.,

original: rdzas la nus pa tha dad snang //
analyzed: rdzas la nus pa tha dad snang //
translated: a different potentiality is seen in a substance.

original: de la gcig mthong @269a * //
analyzed: de la gcig mthong @269a * //
translated: And, since one is seen,

original: bas gzhan na de yod par nges par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bas gzhan na de yod par nges par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable to ascertain the existence of the other.

original: gal te ji zhig ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba tsam gyis 'brel pa med pa yang de 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji zhig ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba tsam gyis 'brel pa med pa yang de 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
translated: If, in some way, there is no connection even with a mere seeing of the dissimilar class, then there is no error.

original: yul 'ga' zhig na rdzas kha cig ci zhig ltar mthong ba gzhan na gzhan du yang snang ngo //
analyzed: yul 'ga' zhig na rdzas kha cig ci zhig ltar mthong ba gzhan na gzhan du yang snang ngo //
translated: In certain places, certain substances are seen in a certain way, and in other places, in another way.

original: dper na sman kha cig zhing khyad par can las ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa khyad par can du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na sman kha cig zhing khyad par can las ro dang nus pa dang khyad par du smin par byed pa khyad par can du 'gyur la /
translated: For example, certain medicines, in a certain field, have a certain taste, a certain power, and a certain maturity;

original: gzhan la ni ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: in another field, they have another taste, another power, and another maturity.

original: dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same for the time and the manner of taking.

original: yul de pa rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te /
analyzed: yul de pa rnams kyis de ltar mthong zhes te /
translated: The inhabitants of the country think that they see the medicine in its true nature;

original: thams cad de nyid du de lta bu yin par ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad de nyid du de lta bu yin par ni 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: but this does not prove that the medicine is such as they think.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams ni rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par rnams ni rgyu'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The qualities of the medicine depend on the qualities of its causes.

original: rgyu'i khyad par med na ni rjes su dpag tu rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par med na ni rjes su dpag tu rung ste /
translated: If the causes are not the same, the effect is not the same.

original: byed pa po ma mthong ba can gyi tshig kyang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: byed pa po ma mthong ba can gyi tshig kyang skyes bu'i 'du byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The words of the Veda are preceded by human action, because they are words, like any other words.

original: tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: because there is no difference in the words.

original: rnam pa thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because in all aspects, men are seen to be the cause.

original: legs par bya ba'i bye brag las khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: legs par bya ba'i bye brag las khyad par rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: because the difference is understood from the difference in the action.üîΩbecause the difference is seen in all the qualities.

original: yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong bas na gang gis ni tshig la sogs pa cung zad tsam chos mthun pas rnam pa thams cad du mthun par rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba de lta bur skyes bu dag ni rgyu'i khyad par med pa can ma yinüîΩpa nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong bas na gang gis ni tshig la sogs pa cung zad tsam chos mthun pas rnam pa thams cad du mthun par rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba de lta bur skyes bu dag ni rgyu'i khyad par med pa can ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, men are not without a difference in their causes, because of the similarity of a few things, such as words, etc.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible in the same way in other cases.

original: mi srid par rjes su dpag pa yang gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi srid par rjes su dpag pa yang gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The inference of impossibility is not contradicted, because there is no reason to contradict it.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: because one who is free from passion is not seen.

original: ma mthong bar yang gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong bar yang gnod par bya ba dang / gnod par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And without seeing, the state of being the object to be contradicted and the means of contradiction is not established.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error that is the effect of attachment, etc.

original: srid kyang khyad par rnams blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid kyang khyad par rnams blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there were, it would be impossible to see the differences.

original: de lta bu dag ni spang bar 'os pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni spang bar 'os pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And it is not proper to reject such things.

original: tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Words are not like that.

original: khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their differences can be seen.

original: bltar mi rung ba zhig yin na yang khyad par ma mthong ba rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid du khas len pa @269b 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba zhig yin na yang khyad par ma mthong ba rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid du khas len pa @269b 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they cannot be seen, it is contradictory to accept that they are not of the same type when their differences are not seen.

original: de'i khyad par rnams ni gzhan la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par rnams ni gzhan la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their differences can be applied to others.

original: sgra mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i yang phyir ro //üîΩ'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgra mngon sum pa rnams la mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i yang phyir ro // 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the directly perceptible sounds do not have an imperceptible nature.üîΩBecause there is no basis for error.

original: gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pas 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because error is not established without a cause of error.

original: skyes bu dag ni khyad par mthong ba gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dag ni khyad par mthong ba gnod par byed pa yin pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: But the person is not similar, because it is seen to be harmed by the difference.

original: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni de'i khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor gyur pa ni de'i khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the difference of the word is not the difference of that [person], because it is a different entity.

original: de'i phyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad skyes bus byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad skyes bus byed do //
translated: Therefore, all things that are not different by nature are created by a person.üîΩOr else, none are.

original: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //üîΩgzhan yang // bdag dang sa la shes yod sogs //
analyzed: yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no // gzhan yang // bdag dang sa la shes yod sogs //
translated: Moreover:

original: med pa rab sgrub byed min pa'i //
analyzed: med pa rab sgrub byed min pa'i //
translated: The non-establishment of the non-existence of self, earth, and so on,

original: mi dmigs gang yin de kho na //
analyzed: mi dmigs gang yin de kho na //
translated: is not due to the non-observation of that.

original: gtan tshigs med sgrub yin nam ci //
analyzed: gtan tshigs med sgrub yin nam ci //
translated: Is it not the establishment of the non-existent due to the non-observation of that?

original: mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa 'di'i bdag dngos su smra ba yang dmigs pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tshad mar byed pa 'di'i bdag dngos su smra ba yang dmigs pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: For the proponents of real self, this making non-observation a valid cognition would be non-observation,

original: bdag mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the self is not directly perceived and because the result is not established.

original: dbang po la sogs pa ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa res 'gag pa yin pa'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pas rab tu 'grub par brjod de /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa ni 'bras bu rnam par shes pa res 'gag pa yin pa'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pas rab tu 'grub par brjod de /
translated: The sense faculties and so on are established as having a purpose because they are established as having a function, since they are the causes of the effect, consciousness, which sometimes ceases.

original: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod do zhes bya ba yin gyi 'di lta bur gyur ba zhig go zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod do zhes bya ba yin gyi 'di lta bur gyur ba zhig go zhes bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The question is, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of this?‚Äù not ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù

original: 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa rab tu bsgrubs pa ni de ltar don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu bde ba la sogs pa rab tu bsgrubs pa ni de ltar don cung zad kyang rgyas par mi byed de /
translated: The establishment of the effect, such as pleasure, is not like that, because it does not increase the slightest bit.

original: gang yang rung bas rgyu dang ldan par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang rung bas rgyu dang ldan par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that it has a cause.

original: de lta yin dang / bdag mi dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang / bdag mi dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: If that were so, the self would be unobservable.

original: des de sel ba na ci ste mi dmigs pa bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes bsal /
analyzed: des de sel ba na ci ste mi dmigs pa bsgrub pa ma yin no zhes bsal /
translated: If it is eliminated by that, why is it not established that it is unobservable?

original: ldog pa ji ltar sgrub par byed //
analyzed: ldog pa ji ltar sgrub par byed //
translated: How does one establish a negative?

original: yang la la ni sa la pa yod par mi dmigs par 'dod bzhin du yang ma mthong bas tshig la sogs pa ldog par smra'o //
analyzed: yang la la ni sa la pa yod par mi dmigs par 'dod bzhin du yang ma mthong bas tshig la sogs pa ldog par smra'o //
translated: Some assert that the negation of the existence of sound and so on is established by the nonobservation of the existent, even though they assert that sound and so on are not observed.

original: gzhan ni 'o ma la sogs pa zho la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni 'o ma la sogs pa zho la sogs pa ste /
translated: The other is milk, etc., and the curd, etc.

original: gzhan gyi don ma yin pa dag la 'dus pa nyid ma mthong bas ldog pa'o //üîΩ'di la 'dus pa dag ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi don yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ma yin pa dag la 'dus pa nyid ma mthong bas ldog pa'o // 'di la 'dus pa dag ni gdon mi za bar gzhan gyi don yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-other is not seen as a collection, and so is excluded.

original: zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the certainty here that a collection necessarily is the other?

original: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /üîΩmi nus pa las mi 'byung @270a * //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa la zho la sogs pa dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa kho na ste / mi nus pa las mi 'byung @270a * //
translated: The observation of curd, etc., in milk, etc., is only an inference,

original: ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not occur without the capacity.

original: zhe na / yang nus pa 'di ci yin /
analyzed: zhe na / yang nus pa 'di ci yin /
translated: What is this capacity?

original: ci yod pa de nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci yod pa de nyid yin nam /
translated: Is it just the existent?

original: 'on te gzhan nyid cung zad cig yin //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan nyid cung zad cig yin //
translated: Or is it something else?

original: gal te de nyid yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te de nyid yin na ni //
translated: If it is just the existent,

original: de kho na bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: it would be observed just as it is,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste gzhan zhig yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // ci ste gzhan zhig yin no zhe na /
translated: because there is no difference.üîΩBut if it is something else,

original: ji ltar gzhan yod na de yod de /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan yod na de yod de /
translated: how is it that when the other exists, it exists?

original: nye bar gdags pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa tsam du ni 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be just a designation.

original: 'di ni 'di dag gi phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di dag gi phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: This is their mutual contradiction.

original: de phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa'i //
analyzed: de phyir de tsam dang 'brel pa'i //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the self is related to the aggregates in this way.üîΩ

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid //üîΩbzlog par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid // bzlog par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the nature of that which is related to that is essentially the nature of that.

original: dper na shing gis shing sha pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na shing gis shing sha pa lta bu ste /
translated: Or, it is like a tree and a ≈õim≈õapƒÅ.

original: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' kho na zhig la de skad du grags pa'i phyir de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par 'ga' kho na zhig la de skad du grags pa'i phyir de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin no //
translated: It is well known that a tree is a particular that possesses branches and so on. Therefore, that is its essence.

original: rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor nas kyang ji ltar yod par 'gyur te /
translated: But how could it exist if it abandons its essence?

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its essence is its nature.

original: de'i phyir de ni rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do //üîΩrgyu yis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir 'khrul pa med do // rgyu yis ni /
translated: Therefore, it is not mistaken because it is essentially related.

original: 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the effect is not mistaken in relation to the cause,

original: rgyu ldog pa las 'bras bu ldog par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu ldog pa las 'bras bu ldog par byed do //
translated: the cessation of the cause makes the effect cease.

original: gzhan du na de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de ni de'i 'bras bu nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be its effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa ni ngo bo nyid nges par byed de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo grub pa ni ngo bo nyid nges par byed de /
translated: The establishment of the nature of cause and effect determines its essence.

original: de bas na gnyi ga rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas ldog go //üîΩde lta yin na gcig log pas //
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas ldog go // de lta yin na gcig log pas //
translated: Therefore, the two are related only by intrinsic nature, and so the reason is refuted.üîΩIf that is so, then how can the other

original: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur //üîΩmi la rta mi bdog ces te //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur // mi la rta mi bdog ces te //
translated: be refuted by the refutation of one?üîΩIs it not the case that when a man is said not to own a horse,

original: phyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci //üîΩde bzhin gcig cig nye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phyugs kyang bdog pa min nam ci // de bzhin gcig cig nye ba'i phyir //
translated: he is also said not to own cattle?üîΩIn the same way, how can the other

original: ji ltar gzhan ni nye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan ni nye bar 'gyur //
translated: be present when one is present?

original: mi la phyugs ni bdog ces te //
analyzed: mi la phyugs ni bdog ces te //
translated: Is it not the case that when a man is said to own cattle,

original: de bzhin rta yang bdog gam ci //
analyzed: de bzhin rta yang bdog gam ci //
translated: he is also said to own a horse?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do //üîΩde'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed do // de'i ngo bo'i mtshan nyid dam //
translated: Therefore, the reason makes the probandum understood only by its relation to intrinsic nature.üîΩIt is either by the characteristic of its nature

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: or by the characteristic of its origin.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid dpe de dag gis rab tu ston to //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid dpe de dag gis rab tu ston to //
translated: The fact that it does not occur when the other is absent is demonstrated by those examples.

original: de phyir chos mi mthun dpe la //
analyzed: de phyir chos mi mthun dpe la //
translated: Therefore, in the case of a dissimilar example,

original: nges par 'di la gzhi mi 'dod //
analyzed: nges par 'di la gzhi mi 'dod //
translated: the basis is not admitted to be that.

original: de dag med na'ang de med ces //
analyzed: de dag med na'ang de med ces //
translated: When it is said that it is absent when the other is absent,

original: brjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir //
analyzed: brjod pa las kyang de rtogs phyir //
translated: it is understood from that statement.

original: 'di ltar / dpe la de yi ngo bo dang // rgyu dngos de dag mi shes la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dpe la de yi ngo bo dang // rgyu dngos de dag mi shes la //
translated: In the example, the nature of that, and the cause, are not known.

original: ston te / dpe la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni de'i ngo bor de tsam dang 'brel pas de'i rang gi @270b ngo bo nyid ston to //
analyzed: ston te / dpe la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni de'i ngo bor de tsam dang 'brel pas de'i rang gi @270b ngo bo nyid ston to //
translated: The nature of that is taught in the example, because the property to be established is related to that nature alone.

original: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid med na skyed par byed do zhes tshad ma dpes rab tu ston to //
analyzed: byas pa'i ngo bo nyid skyed par byed pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid med na skyed par byed do zhes tshad ma dpes rab tu ston to //
translated: The valid means of knowledge teaches by example: that which produces the nature of the produced does not produce the nature of the impermanent.

original: de lta ma yin na chos gcig yod pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar nges pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul par dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na chos gcig yod pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa yang yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar nges pa med pa'i phyir 'khrul par dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be necessary to state that the existence of one property would imply the existence of another, because there would be no certainty.

original: tshad ma nges kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi de tsam dang 'brel pa ston te /
analyzed: tshad ma nges kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi de tsam dang 'brel pa ston te /
translated: The valid means of knowledge also teaches the relation of that alone to the property to be established.

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las byas pa 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos gang yin pa de lta bu skyes te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las byas pa 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos gang yin pa de lta bu skyes te /
translated: That which is produced from its own cause alone, having the nature of destruction, is a momentary phenomenon.

original: gzhan las de yod pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las de yod pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is refuted as existing from another.

original: yang na rgyu'i dngos por te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i dngos por te /
translated: Or else, it is in the nature of a cause,

original: yod pa nyid yin na yod pa'i phyir ro zhes don gzhan rab tu ston to //
analyzed: yod pa nyid yin na yod pa'i phyir ro zhes don gzhan rab tu ston to //
translated: because if it exists, it exists. Thus, he demonstrates another meaning.

original: de ltar de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu grub na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med la me med na yang du ste /
analyzed: de ltar de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu grub na mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med la me med na yang du ste /
translated: Thus, if the nature and cause of that are established, then if impermanence does not exist, then the produced does not exist, and if fire does not exist, then smoke does not exist.

original: 'di ltar de ni rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin na /
translated: In this way, if that is the nature and cause,

original: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu med par yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu med par yod par 'gyur /
translated: how could it exist without its nature and cause?

original: de bas na gzhi med pa yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog pa rab tu grub po //
analyzed: de bas na gzhi med pa yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog pa rab tu grub po //
translated: Therefore, the absence of a basis is also established in the counterexample.

original: gang dag la de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po dag rab tu grub pa'i mkhas pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: gang dag la de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po dag rab tu grub pa'i mkhas pa rnams la ni /
translated: For those who are skilled in establishing the nature and cause of that,

original: gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par zad /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'ba' zhig brjod par zad /
translated: only the reason is stated.

original: gang gi don du dpe brjod pa'i don de grub pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe de brjod pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gang gi don du dpe brjod pa'i don de grub pa kho na yin pas de'i tshe de brjod pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Since the meaning of the example is established just by that, what is the use of stating it at that time?

original: de rab tu bstan na yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhis ci zhig bya snyam du dgongs shing gzhi spang bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de rab tu bstan na yang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i gzhis ci zhig bya snyam du dgongs shing gzhi spang bar mdzad do //
translated: For this very reason, it is said:

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel shes na //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'brel shes na //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the connection is understood,

original: gnyis las gang yang rung smras pas //
analyzed: gnyis las gang yang rung smras pas //
translated: by stating either one,

original: don gyis go bas cig shos la'ang /
analyzed: don gyis go bas cig shos la'ang /
translated: the other is understood by implication,

original: dran pa yang dag skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag skye bar 'gyur //
translated: and recollection arises correctly.‚Äù

original: yang na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na don gyis go bas gang yang rung bas gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Or, it is explained that by understanding the meaning, either one can teach both.

original: der yang dpes de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu ston par dgongs te /
analyzed: der yang dpes de'i ngo bo dang rgyu'i dngos po rab tu ston par dgongs te /
translated: There also, it is intended that the example teaches the nature and cause of that.

original: don gyis go bas gcig brjod pas cig shos 'grub par bshad do //
analyzed: don gyis go bas gcig brjod pas cig shos 'grub par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that by understanding the meaning, when one is stated, the other is established.

original: 'di ltar gang byas pa de ni mi rtog pa'o zhes smras na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang byas pa de ni mi rtog pa'o zhes smras na /
translated: Thus, when it is said, ‚ÄúThat which is produced is impermanent,‚Äù

original: don tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: don tha dad pa med na /
translated: if there is no difference in meaning,

original: gsal bar 'di ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid de tsam dang 'brel pa tshad mas mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal bar 'di ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid de tsam dang 'brel pa tshad mas mthong ba yin no zhes bya bar nges par 'gyur te /
translated: it is ascertained that ‚Äúthis is its nature, merely connected with that,‚Äù and it is seen by valid cognition.

original: de yod par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ascertained that it exists.

original: de bas na de'i ngo bor shes bas ni don gyis go @271a * //
analyzed: de bas na de'i ngo bor shes bas ni don gyis go @271a * //
translated: Therefore, when one knows its nature, one understands the meaning.

original: bas mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do //
analyzed: bas mi rtag pa nyid med na byas pa nyid med do //
translated: If impermanence does not exist, then the produced does not exist.

original: zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is.

original: rang gi ngo bo med par yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo med par yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Without its own nature, it would not exist,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different.

original: de lta ma yin na de yod do zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de yod do zhes bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be said that it exists.

original: de bzhin du de med na med do zhes smras na /
analyzed: de bzhin du de med na med do zhes smras na /
translated: In the same way, when it is said that if that does not exist, this does not exist,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa las 'di ltar 'di ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du rig pa las 'di ltar 'di ni 'di'i ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: it is known that it is its nature. Thus, this is its nature.

original: des ni de med na med do //
analyzed: des ni de med na med do //
translated: Because of that, if that does not exist, this does not exist.

original: de lta ma yin na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be right.

original: de'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs pas rjes su 'gro ba dran pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, when one understands its nature, the memory of its concomitance arises.

original: de bzhin du gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes smras na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes smras na /
translated: In the same way, when it is said that where there is smoke there is fire,

original: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin ne //
analyzed: du ba ni me'i 'bras bu yin ne //
translated: smoke is the effect of fire.

original: des na du ba yod na gdon mi za bar me yod do //
analyzed: des na du ba yod na gdon mi za bar me yod do //
translated: Therefore, if smoke exists, fire exists without a doubt.

original: de lta ma yin na don gzhan de dang 'brel par nges pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo rang dbang can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don gzhan de dang 'brel par nges pa med pa'i phyir ngo bo rang dbang can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because it would not be ascertained as related to that other object, it would be an independent entity.

original: des na de med kyang rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de med kyang rang gi ngo bo ma tshang ba med pa'i phyir med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if that does not exist, it would not be nonexistent because its own nature would not be incomplete.

original: 'bras bu yin na ni gdon mi za bar rgyu yod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin na ni gdon mi za bar rgyu yod do //
translated: If it is an effect, then without a doubt there is a cause.

original: rgyu rgyu nyid yin pa ni de kho na yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rgyu nyid yin pa ni de kho na yin te /
translated: The cause is just that which is the cause.

original: don gzhan yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan yod na rang gi ngo bo nye bar 'jog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which, when another object exists, establishes its own nature.

original: 'bras bu yang de yod pa nyid na yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang de yod pa nyid na yod pa yin no //
translated: And the effect exists only when that exists.

original: de yang du ba la yod do //
analyzed: de yang du ba la yod do //
translated: And that exists in smoke.

original: de lta bas na du ba ni 'bras bu yin no zhes rjes su 'gro bas de'i 'bras bu nyid shes pas me med na du ba med do zhes don gyis go bas ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na du ba ni 'bras bu yin no zhes rjes su 'gro bas de'i 'bras bu nyid shes pas me med na du ba med do zhes don gyis go bas ldog pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, smoke is the effect. By the positive concomitance, its being the effect is known. By the negative concomitance, the absence of smoke is known when there is the absence of fire.

original: de bzhin du me med na du ba med do zhes smras na /
analyzed: de bzhin du me med na du ba med do zhes smras na /
translated: In the same way, if one says, ‚ÄúWhen there is no fire, there is no smoke,‚Äù

original: me las du ba gdon mi za bar 'byung ngo zhes shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so //
analyzed: me las du ba gdon mi za bar 'byung ngo zhes shugs kyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs so //
translated: One infers the invariable concomitance by the method of difference, wherever there is no fire, there is no smoke, and then one understands the pervasion, wherever there is smoke, there is fire.

original: de lta ma yin na de med na ci ste yod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de med na ci ste yod par mi 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, if there were no fire, how could there be smoke?

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin yang de dag med na nyan pa'i shes pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i don gyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin yang de dag med na nyan pa'i shes pa med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But even if there is no effect in the form of a permanent or impermanent object, is not the cognition of sound still absent when there is no object?

original: med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not absent.

original: de las de dag nyid the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las de dag nyid the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of doubt about those very things.

original: de lta ma yin na med pas nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na med pas nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, because of the certainty of their absence,

original: ji ltar de dag gi ngo bo la ltos nas the tshom du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag gi ngo bo la ltos nas the tshom du 'gyur /
translated: how could there be doubt about their nature, in dependence on which there would be doubt?

original: yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir med do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //üîΩgang gi tshe dpes me dang du ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi ston pa de'i tshe ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod par nges pa med pa'i phyir med do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do // gang gi tshe dpes me dang du ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi ston pa de'i tshe ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is simply said, It does not exist, because there is no certainty of its existence.

original: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang na du ba yod pa de na me yod do zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: When the example does not show that fire and smoke are the entities of cause and effect, then it is not the case that wherever there is smoke there is fire, because there is no connection.

original: me med na du ba med do zhes @271b shugs kyis ldog pa 'grub pa dang / de bzhin du chos mi mthun pas med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: me med na du ba med do zhes @271b shugs kyis ldog pa 'grub pa dang / de bzhin du chos mi mthun pas med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir //
translated: And in the same way, the absence of the dissimilar example is not established.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dran par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dran par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How then could there be recollection of the positive concomitance?

original: gang gi phyir de med ni mi srid pas gcig yod na gzhan rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med ni mi srid pas gcig yod na gzhan rab tu grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is impossible for the one to exist without the other, in order to establish the presence of the other when one is present,

original: dpes ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa 'di kho na rab tu ston pa /
analyzed: dpes ji skad bshad pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa 'di kho na rab tu ston pa /
translated: this very nature of the example, as it has been explained, is taught to be the relation.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag / med pa 'ga' zhig sgrub pa'i yang //üîΩgtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag / med pa 'ga' zhig sgrub pa'i yang // gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: Therefore, the reason is the absence of the cause and the absence of the nature of some other thing.

original: de dag kho na ldog pa na rang gi 'brel pa zlog par byed pas de'i phyir don gzhan 'ga' zhig dgag pa dang sgrub par 'dod pas //
analyzed: de dag kho na ldog pa na rang gi 'brel pa zlog par byed pas de'i phyir don gzhan 'ga' zhig dgag pa dang sgrub par 'dod pas //
translated: Because when only those are absent, the relation of the other is negated, therefore, one who wishes to negate or affirm some other object

original: rgyu'am rang bzhin khyab par byed pa ldog pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'am rang bzhin khyab par byed pa ldog pa'i gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: must state the reason as the absence of the cause or the absence of the pervader.

original: ma 'brel na ni ji ltar gcig log pas gzhan ldog pa sgrub par byed /
analyzed: ma 'brel na ni ji ltar gcig log pas gzhan ldog pa sgrub par byed /
translated: But if there is no relation, how can the negation of one establish the negation of the other?

original: dmigs par ni /
analyzed: dmigs par ni /
translated: As for the object of reference,

original: rigs ldan de mi rigs par yang //
analyzed: rigs ldan de mi rigs par yang //
translated: it is the presence of a member of the class, even though it is not reasonable.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This is the reason for negation.

original: dgag pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs la de'i gtan tshigs zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dgag pa'i yul can gyi tha snyad kyi gtan tshigs la de'i gtan tshigs zhes bshad de /
translated: The reason for a conventional negation is called its reason,

original: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni rang nyid kyis dgag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni rang nyid kyis dgag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because such a non-apprehension is itself the nature of a negation.

original: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa ni gnyi ga'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of a cause and of a differentia is a reason for both.

original: de ltar mi dmigs 'di rnam gsum //
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs 'di rnam gsum //
translated: Thus, this non-apprehension is threefold.

original: bshad kyang rnam pa du ma ste //
analyzed: bshad kyang rnam pa du ma ste //
translated: But it is explained in many ways,üîΩby way of the division of non-comprehension and comprehension

original: de dang de 'gal la sogs pa //üîΩmi rtogs rtogs dbye'i sbyor sgo nas //
analyzed: de dang de 'gal la sogs pa // mi rtogs rtogs dbye'i sbyor sgo nas //
translated: of that and that contradiction, etc.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste /
translated: The reason for negation is only threefold:

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de ltar nges pa dang / rang gi bdag nyid dmigs su yod pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa de ltar nges pa dang / rang gi bdag nyid dmigs su yod pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the non-apprehension of a cause, of a differentia, and of one‚Äôs own nature, which is present if it exists.

original: de ni sbyor ba'i dbang gis de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / rtogs pa'i dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa du mar bshad de /
analyzed: de ni sbyor ba'i dbang gis de dang 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang / rtogs pa'i dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa du mar bshad de /
translated: It is explained in many ways by the method of application, by way of the division of non-realization and realization of that and its opposite.

original: de ma rtogs pa dang / de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa dang / 'gal ba'i 'bras bu rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba dag gis sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩrgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am //
analyzed: de ma rtogs pa dang / de dang 'gal ba rtogs pa dang / 'gal ba'i 'bras bu rtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'i sbyor ba dag gis sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no // rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'am //
translated: As was previously explained, by the method of application of the division of non-realization of that, realization of its opposite, realization of the effect of the opposite, and so on.üîΩThe existence of cause and effect

original: rang bzhin nges par 'byed pa las //
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par 'byed pa las //
translated: or the nature of differentiation,

original: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung nges pa ste //
translated: is the certainty of non-existence without it.

original: ma mthong las min mthong las min //
analyzed: ma mthong las min mthong las min //
translated: It is not from not seeing it, nor from seeing it.üîΩThe certainty of the existence of another

original: gzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
analyzed: gzhan du gzhan ni gzhan dag dang // nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang //
translated: from another is from another.

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos //
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos //
translated: If a phenomenon has another object as its reason,

original: @272a * // yin na gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: @272a * // yin na gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: it is like a cloth with a dye.

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go //üîΩgzhan yang / chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dag go // gzhan yang / chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can //
translated: These are the intermediate verses.üîΩMoreover, if a phenomenon has another object as its reason,

original: yin par gyur na de gzhan nyid //
analyzed: yin par gyur na de gzhan nyid //
translated: it is another.

original: de grub na ma grub pa'am rgyu tha dad pa ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //üîΩdngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: de grub na ma grub pa'am rgyu tha dad pa ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no // dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'am /
translated: If that is established, then it is not reasonable that what is not established or different causes would be its nature.üîΩThe difference of things

original: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te /üîΩchos 'gal ba gnas pa'am //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ni 'di kho na yin te / chos 'gal ba gnas pa'am //
translated: or different causes is just this:üîΩthe presence of contradictory properties

original: rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa yin no //
translated: or different causes.

original: gal te de dag kyang tha dad par byed pa yin na gang yang gang las kyang tha dad par byed pa med pas ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang tha dad par byed pa yin na gang yang gang las kyang tha dad par byed pa med pas ril rdzas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: If those also cause difference, then since there is no difference from anything at all, everything would be a single substance.

original: des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang thams cad la thams cad nye bar sbyar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang thams cad la thams cad nye bar sbyar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, arising and disintegrating together and everything being applied to everything would follow.

original: de lta ma yin na gcig ces bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gcig ces bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If that were not so, then it would not be a single thing,

original: ming tha dad par zad de /
analyzed: ming tha dad par zad de /
translated: or it would be just a different name.

original: don khas blangs nas de skad du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don khas blangs nas de skad du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stated in that way after accepting the meaning.

original: rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang dngos po'i dus na /
analyzed: rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang dngos po'i dus na /
translated: Even though the meaning of the cause is not different, at the time of the thing

original: mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin ma yin par mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not similar that it is not the nature of something that is not established as impermanent?

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba gang phyis 'grub par 'gyur pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba gang phyis 'grub par 'gyur pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med pa yin te /
translated: There is no other so-called impermanence that will be established later.

original: dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos kho na mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos kho na mi rtag pa nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of a thing is the mere fact that it abides momentarily.

original: chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa la yang rgyu mtshan bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi tshig tha dad pa la yang rgyu mtshan bshad par bya'o //
translated: The difference in words between the phenomenon and the subject should be explained as a reason.

original: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar skye ba'i phyir 'di'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid de ni mthong bzhin du yang blo gzhan pa yod pa dmigs pas rtag tu de ltar yod par dgos pas bslus pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu kho na las de ltar skye ba'i phyir 'di'i rang bzhin skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid de ni mthong bzhin du yang blo gzhan pa yod pa dmigs pas rtag tu de ltar yod par dgos pas bslus pa'am /
translated: Because it arises in that way from its own cause alone, its nature is the mere fact that it abides momentarily. That is seen. But because the existence of another mind is observed, it is deceived by the need for it to always exist in that way.

original: 'dra gzhan 'byung pas bslus pas mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'dra gzhan 'byung pas bslus pas mi rtogs so //
translated: Or it is not understood because it is deceived by the arising of another similar one.

original: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la nges pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is ascertained for those who see the final moment.

original: phyis 'di mi dmigs pas mi gnas par rtogs pa'i phyir de'i tshe nges pa'i dus yin pas mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phyis 'di mi dmigs pas mi gnas par rtogs pa'i phyir de'i tshe nges pa'i dus yin pas mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: because later, when it is not observed, it is understood that it does not endure. Therefore, at that time, it is ascertained and is posited as impermanent.

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa rgyu'i dngos po nyid yin yang 'bras bu ma mthong ba rgyu mthong du zin kyang de'i ngo bo ma rtogs pas 'bras bu mthong bas rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa'i nus pa rgyu'i dngos po nyid yin yang 'bras bu ma mthong ba rgyu mthong du zin kyang de'i ngo bo ma rtogs pas 'bras bu mthong bas rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Even though the state of being a cause is the capacity to generate an effect, when the effect is not seen, even though the cause is seen, since its nature is not understood, it is as if the effect is not seen.

original: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan nyid yin nam /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan nyid yin nam /
translated: If that were not so, then impermanence would be a different object.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa can nyid yin yang rung ste /
translated: It would be either a sign of another or it would be signless.

original: mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a different object alone.

original: de lta na ni dngos @272b po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni dngos @272b po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would not be related to that thing,

original: de la mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be necessary for it.

original: 'on te dgos na ni de nyid 'di'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid yin pas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'on te dgos na ni de nyid 'di'i rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i mi rtag pa nyid yin pas gzhan gyis ci zhig bya /
translated: But if it is necessary, then that itself is its own impermanence. What would another do?

original: rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba ni don gzhan dang ldan yang de'i ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi rtag pa nyid dam chos gzhan de yang don gzhan las 'byung ba na rgyu yin pa'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo ba ni don gzhan dang ldan yang de'i ngo bor mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // mi rtag pa nyid dam chos gzhan de yang don gzhan las 'byung ba na rgyu yin pa'am /
translated: If it is not essentially different, then it is not tenable that it is the nature of that.

original: 'bras bu yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: If that impermanence or other phenomenon arises from another object, then it would be the cause or the effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin pa ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is neither the cause nor the effect, then it is not related to that.

original: de la yod par rjes su dpag par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yod par rjes su dpag par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to infer its existence.

original: de la / phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
analyzed: de la / phyis 'byung phyir na rgyu nyid min //
translated: If it arises later, it is not the cause.

original: 'bras bu na yang ga la nges //
analyzed: 'bras bu na yang ga la nges //
translated: How could it be ascertained as the effect?

original: de dngos po grub nas phyis don gzhan las 'byung na ji ltar de'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: de dngos po grub nas phyis don gzhan las 'byung na ji ltar de'i rgyu yin /
translated: If it exists as an established entity and later arises from another object, how could it be the cause of that?

original: 'bras bu yang rgyu la gdon mi za ba ma yin pas de'i go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rgyu la gdon mi za ba ma yin pas de'i go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: And if it is not necessarily the effect of the cause, then the reason that proves it is inconclusive.

original: de'i phyir don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos ni dngos po la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pas rjes su dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos ni dngos po la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin pas rjes su dpag tu med do //
translated: Therefore, since a property that has a different object as its reason does not exist in a thing, it is not inferred.

original: 'o na gal te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa'i rten ma yin na ji ltar du bas mer 'khrul lo zhes bya bar rtogs she na //
analyzed: 'o na gal te mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pa'i rten ma yin na ji ltar du bas mer 'khrul lo zhes bya bar rtogs she na //
translated: If seeing and not seeing are not the basis for understanding the pervasion and the counter pervasion, then how is it understood that smoke is mistaken for fire?üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
analyzed: 'di ltar / me yi 'bras bu du ba ste //
translated: Smoke is the effect of fire,

original: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir //üîΩde'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs na dmigs la /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos kyi rjes 'jug phyir // de'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa las gang dag dmigs na dmigs la /
translated: because the effect is concomitant with the property.üîΩWhen the effect is not perceived, the cause is not perceived.

original: de las gcig med na yang mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de las gcig med na yang mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: When one of them is not perceived, the other is not perceived. That which is not perceived is the effect of that.

original: de yang du ba las yod do //
analyzed: de yang du ba las yod do //
translated: That is also the case with smoke.

original: de med par ni de yod na //
analyzed: de med par ni de yod na //
translated: If it existed without that,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa las 'das 'gyur //
translated: it would be without a cause.

original: lan cig de ltar mthong bas kyang 'bras bu grub ste /
analyzed: lan cig de ltar mthong bas kyang 'bras bu grub ste /
translated: Even though it is seen that way once, the effect is established.

original: 'bras bu nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ma yin na /
translated: If it were not the effect,

original: rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa las lan cig kyang mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not arise even once from a noncause.

original: 'bras bu yang rang gi rgyu med par yod na ni rgyu dang mi ldan pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rang gi rgyu med par yod na ni rgyu dang mi ldan pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: And if the effect exists without its cause, it would be causeless.

original: gang zhig gang med par yod pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par yod pa de ni de'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: For that which exists without something else is not the cause of that.

original: me med par yang du ba yod de /
analyzed: me med par yang du ba yod de /
translated: Smoke exists without fire.

original: des na de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te gzhan gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na de'i rgyu ma yin par 'gyur ro // gal te gzhan gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it would not be the cause of that.

original: rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not causeless because it has another cause,

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the same problem would arise for that cause.

original: de med na yang me yod na @273a * //
analyzed: de med na yang me yod na @273a * //
translated: Smoke exists without that cause, fire.

original: yod pas so //
analyzed: yod pas so //
translated: Therefore, it would not be the cause of that.

original: yang de'am gzhan yang rung /
analyzed: yang de'am gzhan yang rung /
translated: And whether it is that or another,

original: de bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las ni ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: how could it arise from that which is not by nature productive of it?

original: de'i rang gis de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang gis de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas mi bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not by nature productive of it does not produce it.

original: de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be causeless.

original: de nyid ni ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: That is not so.

original: de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it arises from something similar to it.

original: mi 'dra ba las 'byung ba ji ltar de dang 'dra bas yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba las 'byung ba ji ltar de dang 'dra bas yin te /
