analyzed: gcig pu des de rnams kyi tha snyad pa nyid sel tam /
translated: Does that one entity remove the difference of those manifestations?

original: ci ste tha dad pa nyid ni de dag la gcig gi rnam par shes pa mi bskyed pa nyid kyi rgyu yin par brjod do //
analyzed: ci ste tha dad pa nyid ni de dag la gcig gi rnam par shes pa mi bskyed pa nyid kyi rgyu yin par brjod do //
translated: Or do you say that the difference of those manifestations is the cause of the non-production of the cognition of one?üîΩIf you think that many are not different

original: gal te du ma'ang gcig ltos nas //üîΩtha dad min blo skyed ce na //
analyzed: gal te du ma'ang gcig ltos nas //üîΩtha dad min blo skyed ce na //
translated: because they are produced from one,

original: tha dad pa'i phyir du mas gcig gi shes pa mi bskyed do zhes ni mi smra ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir du mas gcig gi shes pa mi bskyed do zhes ni mi smra ste /
translated: We do not say that many things do not produce the cognition of one thing because they are different.

original: tha dad pas skye ba la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: tha dad pas skye ba la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction in production by difference.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bral bas 'gal te /
analyzed: bral bas 'gal te /
translated: There is a contradiction in separation.

original: des na gcig dang lhan cig pas skyed par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na gcig dang lhan cig pas skyed par byed pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is only by one thing together with another that there is production.

original: de ltar na 'o na ni /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni /
translated: If that is so, then

original: de dag re re med par yang //
analyzed: de dag re re med par yang //
translated: even without each of them,

original: de gcig gis kyang bskyed bya ba'i //
analyzed: de gcig gis kyang bskyed bya ba'i //
translated: one of them would produce the cognition,

original: blo la de rnams nus med phyir //
analyzed: blo la de rnams nus med phyir //
translated: because they are not capable of that cognition.

original: blo yis 'dzin pa med pa yin //üîΩde ni 'di ltar shes pa de la bsal ba rnams kyi nus pa rtogs te /
analyzed: blo yis 'dzin pa med pa yin // de ni 'di ltar shes pa de la bsal ba rnams kyi nus pa rtogs te /
translated: The cognition would not apprehend them.

original: de rnams las re re med kyang de yod pa'i phyir dang / spyi med na med pa'i phyir la gzhan du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams las re re med kyang de yod pa'i phyir dang / spyi med na med pa'i phyir la gzhan du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the capacity of the removed things is understood in that cognition, because even without each of them, it exists, and because it does not exist without the universal, and because it exists elsewhere.

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa la re re bsal kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye la de dag gi tshogs pa la yang @291a * //
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa la re re bsal kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa skye la de dag gi tshogs pa la yang @291a * //
translated: This is not a fault, just as even when each of blue and so on is removed, eye consciousness arises, and it arises from their collection.

original: nus pa med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang so sor re re bsal na yang skye bas dus thams cad du nus pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang so sor re re bsal na yang skye bas dus thams cad du nus pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Just as the eye, etc. are not incapable of producing their own effects, so too, even though they are individually removed, arising is not incapable at all times.

original: mi mthun par nye bar bkod pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun par nye bar bkod pa ste /
translated: This is an inappropriate analogy.üîΩFor,

original: 'di ltar / sngo sogs mig gi rnam shes la //üîΩnus pa so sor mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / sngo sogs mig gi rnam shes la // nus pa so sor mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: The eye consciousness of blue, etc.üîΩIs seen to have a capacity for each.

original: tshogs la'ang nus grub bsal ba las //
analyzed: tshogs la'ang nus grub bsal ba las //
translated: Since the capacity is established in the collection,

original: ji ltar yang na de ltar min //
analyzed: ji ltar yang na de ltar min //
translated: It is not like that in the slightest.

original: dbang po la sogs pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa la so so'i nus pa yang mthong bas tshogs pa la yang nus pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa la mig gi rnam par shes pa la so so'i nus pa yang mthong bas tshogs pa la yang nus pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: Since the eye consciousness, etc. are seen to have a capacity for each in the eye, etc., it is not contradictory that the capacity is established in the collection.

original: bsal ba rnams ni spyi la mi ltos par nam yang de ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsal ba rnams ni spyi la mi ltos par nam yang de ltar rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But the particulars never generate a consciousness that conforms to them without relying on the universal.

original: de lta bas na bsal ba rnams kyis de la mi nus pa kho na yin pas de rnams mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsal ba rnams kyis de la mi nus pa kho na yin pas de rnams mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the particulars are incapable of that, they would not be apprehended.

original: gal te de dag 'ga' zhig la //
analyzed: gal te de dag 'ga' zhig la //
translated: If they are not apprehended,

original: ltos nas de nus 'ba' zhig min //üîΩ'on te tha ga pa thag zong med par ras yug mi 'thag la /
analyzed: ltos nas de nus 'ba' zhig min // 'on te tha ga pa thag zong med par ras yug mi 'thag la /
translated: But it is not the case that the cloth is produced from the warp alone.üîΩBut if the weaver does not have the warp and weft, he cannot weave the cloth.

original: thag pa thag zong re re med kyang 'thags  pas de kho na las ras yug 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thag pa thag zong re re med kyang 'thags  pas de kho na las ras yug 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But the cloth is not produced from the warp and weft, one by one.

original: de bzhin du bsal ba re re bsal ba la rnam par shes pa skye ba la yang spyi 'ba' zhig pa de ni rgyu ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsal ba re re bsal ba la rnam par shes pa skye ba la yang spyi 'ba' zhig pa de ni rgyu ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: In the same way, it is not the case that the cognition is produced from the universal alone, when one of the particulars is present.üîΩBut if the cognition is produced from the particulars,

original: bsal ba rnams kyi nang nas gcig 'ba' zhig la ltos nas rnam par shes pa bskyed do snyam du sems na /
analyzed: bsal ba rnams kyi nang nas gcig 'ba' zhig la ltos nas rnam par shes pa bskyed do snyam du sems na /
translated: then you should think that the cognition is produced from one of the particulars alone.

original: de lta yin na /üîΩde dag de gcig la phan na //
analyzed: de lta yin na / de dag de gcig la phan na //
translated: If that were so,

original: ji ltar blo gcig nyid ma yin //
analyzed: ji ltar blo gcig nyid ma yin //
translated: then how could the cognition be one,üîΩwhen the particulars are many?

original: don tha dad pa rnams don gcig la sbyor ba 'gal bas 'di thams cad brtsams pa yin la /
analyzed: don tha dad pa rnams don gcig la sbyor ba 'gal bas 'di thams cad brtsams pa yin la /
translated: It is contradictory to connect different objects to a single object.

original: gal te bsal ba de dag kyang spyi gcig la phan 'dogs par byed na /
analyzed: gal te bsal ba de dag kyang spyi gcig la phan 'dogs par byed na /
translated: If the particulars also assist the single universal,

original: de rnams la rnam par shes pas gang gis na de mi bskyed pa'i nyes pa ci zhig byas /
analyzed: de rnams la rnam par shes pas gang gis na de mi bskyed pa'i nyes pa ci zhig byas /
translated: What fault is there in not generating a consciousness of that?

original: de la bar ma dor lhag ma spyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de la bar ma dor lhag ma spyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of a general remaining in the interval?

original: ji ltar 'di dag tha dad kyang spyi gcig la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yod pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa de gcig kho na bskyed la rag mod /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag tha dad kyang spyi gcig la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yod pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa de gcig kho na bskyed la rag mod /
translated: Just as they are different but have the power to benefit a single universal, in the same way, it is possible that a single consciousness is generated.

original: gzhan yang / 'di de rnams kyi 'bras bur 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'di de rnams kyi 'bras bur 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, it would be the effect of those.

original: phan 'dogs gang yin bskyed pa yin //
analyzed: phan 'dogs gang yin bskyed pa yin //
translated: That which benefits is that which generates.

original: sngon rol bzhin du bogs med pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa 'di la ni phan pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med na /
analyzed: sngon rol bzhin du bogs med pa'i bdag nyid 'dzin pa 'di la ni phan pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med na /
translated: If it is maintained that it is an entity that is not different from what it was before, then there is no benefit at all.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow that it is too much.

original: don 'ga' zhig bskyed na @291b ni des de la ci zhig byed //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig bskyed na @291b ni des de la ci zhig byed //
translated: If it generates some object, what would it do to that?

original: de de'i rten nyid yin du phan 'dogs pa med pa la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig yod /
analyzed: de de'i rten nyid yin du phan 'dogs pa med pa la rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig yod /
translated: If it is the basis of that, then what is the relationship between the basis and the dependent when there is no benefit?

original: yang na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or it would follow that it is too much.

original: phan 'dogs na yang de kho na la de 'brel pas de byed pa'i phyir de la phan par byed pa gzhan ci dgos /
analyzed: phan 'dogs na yang de kho na la de 'brel pas de byed pa'i phyir de la phan par byed pa gzhan ci dgos /
translated: If it benefits, then it is related to that, and so it is produced by that. What other benefit could there be for it?

original: de la ltos pa'i rten gyis de la sbyor na ni phan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ltos pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rten gyis de la sbyor na ni phan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ltos pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yod de /
translated: If it is related to the support in dependence on that, then what is the point of saying that it is related to that which does not benefit it?

original: de las skye ba'i chos can ni rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir ltos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las skye ba'i chos can ni rang bzhin 'brel pa'i phyir ltos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which has the quality of being produced is said to be related because of its natural relation.

original: bogs dbyung du med pa can gyi bdag nyid can yang yin la /
analyzed: bogs dbyung du med pa can gyi bdag nyid can yang yin la /
translated: It has the nature of not being able to be improved.

original: gzhan dag la ltos so zhes bya ba 'di ni nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ltos so zhes bya ba 'di ni nyams pa yin no //
translated: It is related to others. This is a contradiction.

original: de lta bas na gang cung zad 'ga' zhig la lar 'brel pa de thams cad ni bskyed par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang cung zad 'ga' zhig la lar 'brel pa de thams cad ni bskyed par bya ba'i khongs su gtogs so //
translated: Therefore, whatever is related to something somewhere, all of that is included in the category of that which is produced.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po bskyed na ni de la phan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po bskyed na ni de la phan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it produces the nature of another, then it is not beneficial to that.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa la yang phan par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa la yang phan par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not do anything at all, then it is not beneficial.

original: de'i phyir bsal bas phan btags pa'i spyis rnam par shes pa bskyed na 'di 'di'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur bar gsal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsal bas phan btags pa'i spyis rnam par shes pa bskyed na 'di 'di'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur bar gsal lo //
translated: Therefore, if a universal that is helped by particulars generates a consciousness, it is clearly the result of those particulars.

original: 'ga' zhig gis nus na ni bsal ba rnams kyis nam yang gang la yang nus par ma grub pa'i phyir gzung bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis nus na ni bsal ba rnams kyis nam yang gang la yang nus par ma grub pa'i phyir gzung bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it is able to generate a consciousness, then since it is not established that particulars ever have the ability to generate a consciousness, they are not objects of comprehension.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir bsal ba rnams kyis nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir bsal ba rnams kyis nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that particulars have the ability to generate a consciousness because they appear to consciousness,

original: phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams ji ltar snang ste de nyid spyi khas len na bsam par bya ba yin no //üîΩ'di ltar phan par byed pa ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams ji ltar snang ste de nyid spyi khas len na bsam par bya ba yin no // 'di ltar phan par byed pa ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te /
translated: then how could those that are not established as being helpful appear to consciousness? This is something to be thought about.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not helpful is not an object because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: yul ma yin pa ni rnam par shes pa la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni rnam par shes pa la mi snang ngo //
translated: That which is not an object does not appear to consciousness.

original: gal te phan pa med pa yul nyid ma yin na 'das pa la sogs pa yul nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te phan pa med pa yul nyid ma yin na 'das pa la sogs pa yul nyid ma yin te /
translated: If that which is not helpful is not an object, then the past and so on are not objects.

original: med pa rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: med pa rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is impossible for a nonexistent to have the power to benefit.

original: de dag gi shes pa rnams yul med du zad mod /
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa rnams yul med du zad mod /
translated: It is true that their consciousnesses have no object.

original: yul med du zad kyang nyams su myong ba de lta bus gzhag pa'i bag chags las skye ba'i phyir de'i rjes su byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yul med du zad kyang nyams su myong ba de lta bus gzhag pa'i bag chags las skye ba'i phyir de'i rjes su byed pa ni rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin no //
translated: But even though they have no object, they arise from the latent impressions that are established by such an experience. Therefore, they are merely the nature of consciousness.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir nus pa yin gyi snang ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /üîΩbsal ba la ma gtogs pa spyi mi snang ba'i byed pa yod @292a * //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir nus pa yin gyi snang ba'i phyir ni ma yin te / bsal ba la ma gtogs pa spyi mi snang ba'i byed pa yod @292a * //
translated: They are capable because they follow the existent and the nonexistent, but not because they appear.üîΩThis is because a universal does not appear apart from the particulars, and because the particulars are the cause.

original: pa'i phyir dang / sgra la sogs pa nyams par snang yang de rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dang / sgra la sogs pa nyams par snang yang de rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And this is because even though the particulars such as sound are perceived, they are not the cause.

original: gal te tha dad mi snang blo //
analyzed: gal te tha dad mi snang blo //
translated: If the cognition does not appear as different,

original: tha dad rnams la mi 'dod na //
analyzed: tha dad rnams la mi 'dod na //
translated: and you do not accept that it is different from the particulars,

original: du mas 'bras bu gcig mi byed do zhes ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: du mas 'bras bu gcig mi byed do zhes ni mi smra'o //
translated: we do not say that many particulars do not produce one effect.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What do we say?

original: don tha dad pa rnams la de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa can gyis blo tha mi dad par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don tha dad pa rnams la de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa can gyis blo tha mi dad par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the objects are different, the cognition of them cannot appear without difference.

original: spyi 'dzin pa rnams la ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba nyid de /
analyzed: spyi 'dzin pa rnams la ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba nyid de /
translated: For those who hold the universal, the particular is not perceived.

original: de med kyang de dag yod pa'i phyir dang / rang gi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir dang / gcig la rnam pa du ma mi rung ba'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang de dag yod pa'i phyir dang / rang gi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa gzhan du snang ba'i phyir dang / gcig la rnam pa du ma mi rung ba'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it exists even when that does not exist, because its own consciousness appears in another aspect, because many aspects are not possible in one, and because there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni de las byung zhing don tha dad pa 'dzin pa yin na tha mi dad par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni de las byung zhing don tha dad pa 'dzin pa yin na tha mi dad par snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if this arises from that and apprehends different objects, it cannot appear without difference.

original: de mi snang bas kyang lhag par zhen pa'i 'khrul pas 'jig rten tha snyad 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: de mi snang bas kyang lhag par zhen pa'i 'khrul pas 'jig rten tha snyad 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Even without that appearance, due to the error of excessive attachment, the world makes conventional designations.

original: de la snang ba'i rnam pa de don rnams la med de /
analyzed: de la snang ba'i rnam pa de don rnams la med de /
translated: That aspect of appearance does not exist in the objects.

original: tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the different and non-different.

original: de ni med pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: de ni med pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: That is the nature of non-existence.

original: des de kho na 'dzin pa na de ltar bslad par 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: des de kho na 'dzin pa na de ltar bslad par 'gyur ro zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that when it apprehends reality, it is not so deceived.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang spyi dngos por smra ba'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi dngos por smra ba'i //
translated: if the universal is a real entity,

original: ltar na yang gsal ba rnams tha dad pa kho na yin na ji ltar de dag la blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can yin te /
analyzed: ltar na yang gsal ba rnams tha dad pa kho na yin na ji ltar de dag la blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can yin te /
translated: then the particulars are only different, so how can they have an aspect that is not different?

original: klan ka mtshungs so //
analyzed: klan ka mtshungs so //
translated: The objection is the same.

original: mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the same.

original: de la spyi tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la spyi tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the universal is not different.

original: de la de yod kyang snang ba mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de la de yod kyang snang ba mi rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if it exists there, is it not understood as appearing?

original: de ni kha dog dbyibs su snang bar ldan par yid ches so //
analyzed: de ni kha dog dbyibs su snang bar ldan par yid ches so //
translated: We believe that it is endowed with the appearance of color and shape.

original: spyi ni de lta bu ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: spyi ni de lta bu ma yin no / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: The universal is not like that.

original: de la ma gtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa yang 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa yang 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no other aspect that is not included in it and is not different from it.

original: rnam pa spyi yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang de khyad par bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i sgo nas don gzhan la mi 'jug pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa spyi yin par smra ba'i ltar na yang de khyad par bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i sgo nas don gzhan la mi 'jug pas tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Even according to the theory that the aspect is the universal, because it does not engage other objects by way of being nondifferent like a particular, it is not nondifferent.

original: tha mi dad par snang bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tha mi dad par snang bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for them to appear as undifferentiated.

original: yang na yin du zad de /
analyzed: yang na yin du zad de /
translated: Or else, it is just so.

original: blo yi snang ba tha dad de //
analyzed: blo yi snang ba tha dad de //
translated: The appearance of the cognition is different,

original: de dag mtshungs zhes 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mtshungs zhes 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: but it is grasped as similar.

original: de dag la tha mi dad par snang ba ni med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de dag la tha mi dad par snang ba ni med pa kho na ste /
translated: There is no undifferentiated appearance in them,

original: mtshungs pa zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are grasped as similar.

original: gcig tu snang ba la mtshungs so snyam pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu snang ba la mtshungs so snyam pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to think that the appearance as one is similar.

original: 'o na ci'i zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de nyid 'di yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no snyam mo //
translated: It is just this.

original: gal te gnyi ga 'dzin pa'i @292b phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga 'dzin pa'i @292b phyir nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no fault because both are grasped,

original: 'on kyang de 'di la'o snyam par 'gyur gyi mtshungs so snyam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de 'di la'o snyam par 'gyur gyi mtshungs so snyam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then it would be thought that it is this in that, but not that it is similar.

original: gal te de nyid de dag gi mtshungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid de dag gi mtshungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is the similarity of those,

original: ji ltar gzhan dang gzhan du mtshungs pa yin /üîΩgal te de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dang gzhan du mtshungs pa yin / gal te de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: how is it similar to the other?üîΩIf you say that it is because of the connection with those,

original: zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: rag ma las pa la 'brel par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rag ma las pa la 'brel par mi rung ba'i phyir dang / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that what is not dependent is related, and because there is the fault of overextension.

original: gal te de dag mtshungs na ni //
analyzed: gal te de dag mtshungs na ni //
translated: If they are similar,

original: ji ltar tha dad blos gzung bya //üîΩmtshungs pa'o zhes gzung ba mthong nas 'di dag la tha mi dad par snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad blos gzung bya // mtshungs pa'o zhes gzung ba mthong nas 'di dag la tha mi dad par snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?

original: de mthong ba las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag snang ba'i phyir mtshungs par gtogs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: de mthong ba las tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag snang ba'i phyir mtshungs par gtogs pa ni ma yin no // 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?

original: 'bras bu gcig 'dra /üîΩkho bos ni don gyi shes pa la rnam pa gnyis ma mthong ste /üîΩma mthong na ji ltar don gnyis rab tu brtags pas bdag nyid bslu bar bya /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig 'dra / kho bos ni don gyi shes pa la rnam pa gnyis ma mthong ste / ma mthong na ji ltar don gnyis rab tu brtags pas bdag nyid bslu bar bya /
translated: If they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?

original: bsal ba 'bras bu gcig can rnams ni rtog pa'i yul du nye bar 'gro ste /
analyzed: bsal ba 'bras bu gcig can rnams ni rtog pa'i yul du nye bar 'gro ste /
translated: If they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?

original: de'i phyir 'dis 'khrul pas de ltar bsre bar byed do //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di ni skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis 'khrul pas de ltar bsre bar byed do // zhes bya ba 'di ni skyon med do //
translated: If they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?üîΩIf they are similar, how are they apprehended as different by the mind?

original: de dag gi /
analyzed: de dag gi /
translated: If they are similar, how

original: 'bras blo de yang tha dad do //
analyzed: 'bras blo de yang tha dad do //
translated: And the cognition of the effect is also different.

original: dngos po re re la de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po re re la de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bar tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the consciousness that appears as each thing is also different in the same way.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu gcig pa can dag yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu gcig pa can dag yin /
translated: How are they the same effect?

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni de yin na de yang tha dad do //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni de yin na de yang tha dad do //
translated: If their effect is that, then that is also different.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu chu chu ba la sogs pa gcig po gang yin pa de yang rdzas re re'i khyad par gyi tha dad pa kho na yin pas tha dad pa rnams la 'bras bu gcig pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu chu chu ba la sogs pa gcig po gang yin pa de yang rdzas re re'i khyad par gyi tha dad pa kho na yin pas tha dad pa rnams la 'bras bu gcig pa med do zhe na /
translated: The effect of the pot, etc., is the same, such as holding water, etc., but that is only different by the particularity of each substance. Therefore, those that are different do not have the same effect.

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: 'di ltar / gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yi phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of the cognition of oneness,

original: blo ni tha dad med pa yin //
analyzed: blo ni tha dad med pa yin //
translated: the cognition is undifferentiated.

original: blo gcig rgyu yi dngos po yis //
analyzed: blo gcig rgyu yi dngos po yis //
translated: The single cognition is the cause of the thing,

original: bsal ba rnams kyang tha mi dad //
analyzed: bsal ba rnams kyang tha mi dad //
translated: and the exclusions are also undifferentiated.

original: ji ltar dngos po rnams la rang bzhin 'brel pa med pa 'di yang bshad zin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po rnams la rang bzhin 'brel pa med pa 'di yang bshad zin te /
translated: It has already been explained that things are not related by intrinsic nature.

original: de la bsre ba'i rnam pa can gyi blo ni 'khrul pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: de la bsre ba'i rnam pa can gyi blo ni 'khrul pa kho na yin la /
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of mixing is only mistaken.

original: de ni dngos po tha dad pa rim gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed do //
analyzed: de ni dngos po tha dad pa rim gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed do //
translated: And it is produced by the intrinsic reality of those that are the cause of the gradual conception of different things.

original: zhes kyang bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes kyang bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: 'di dag gi tha dad pa de byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i de ni tha mi dad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi tha dad pa de byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i de ni tha mi dad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The difference of these is not the intrinsic reality of the non-different.

original: shes pa @293a * //
analyzed: shes pa @293a * //
translated: The cognition, etc.

original: la sogs pa gcig 'ba' zhig byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa gcig 'ba' zhig byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are only one, because they are the cause of the conception of difference.

original: de yang rdzas re re la tha dad kyang rang bzhin gyis gcig tu rtogs pa tha mi dad par snyems pa'i rgyur gyur ba na tha mi dad par snang ngo //
analyzed: de yang rdzas re re la tha dad kyang rang bzhin gyis gcig tu rtogs pa tha mi dad par snyems pa'i rgyur gyur ba na tha mi dad par snang ngo //
translated: And that is the cause of the conception of non-difference, because it is the cause of the conception of a single intrinsic nature in each individual substance.üîΩThat cognition, etc.

original: rtogs pa de lta bu'i rgyu tha mi dad par snang pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa de lta bu'i rgyu tha mi dad par snang pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: appear as non-different, because they are the cause of the cognition, etc. that appears as non-different, which is the cause of the conception of that kind.

original: bsal ba rnams kyis kyang rang bzhin gyis gcig gi shes pa rnam par bsre pa rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par don dam pa la brten pa can bskyed do //
analyzed: bsal ba rnams kyis kyang rang bzhin gyis gcig gi shes pa rnam par bsre pa rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par don dam pa la brten pa can bskyed do //
translated: and the exclusions generate a cognition that is essentially different, which is based on the ultimate.

original: zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes lan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained more than once.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu gcig pa kho na dngos po rnams kyi tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu gcig pa kho na dngos po rnams kyi tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sameness of effect alone is the non-difference of things.

original: de / de yi 'bras can min bral ba //
analyzed: de / de yi 'bras can min bral ba //
translated: It is not the effect of that, nor is it disconnected from it.

original: kho na yin te /üîΩde las gzhan rjes 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: kho na yin te / de las gzhan rjes 'gro ba yi //
translated: It is just that.üîΩBecause the subsequent thing is not seen to be different from it,

original: dngos ma mthong phyir bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dngos ma mthong phyir bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: it is excluded.

original: ltar rung ba rnam par dbye bar mi snang ba ni med do zhes bya ba dang / yod na yang gang la yang mi brten na ji ltar shes pa'i rgyu yin zhes de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ltar rung ba rnam par dbye bar mi snang ba ni med do zhes bya ba dang / yod na yang gang la yang mi brten na ji ltar shes pa'i rgyu yin zhes de ni bshad zin to //
translated: It is not the case that what is suitable to appear does not appear, and even if it exists, since it does not depend on anything, how can it be the cause of cognition? This has already been explained.

original: bkag pa byas pa'i yang phyir /
analyzed: bkag pa byas pa'i yang phyir /
translated: Also, because it is excluded.

original: der brtag pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der brtag pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical to imagine it there.

original: de'i phyir / brnga ni yang de rig don can yin pa kho nar rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / brnga ni yang de rig don can yin pa kho nar rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is only logical that the effect is the object of cognition.

original: brda zhig tu byas na yang dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad ba gang yin pa de kho nar shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brda zhig tu byas na yang dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad ba gang yin pa de kho nar shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is a sign, then it is only the difference of things that is to be known.

original: de mi byed pa las tha dad pas 'jug pa nyid du byed na mdzes so //
analyzed: de mi byed pa las tha dad pas 'jug pa nyid du byed na mdzes so //
translated: If it is not that, then it is better to make it operate by way of exclusion.

original: gal te de shes par bya ba'i don du brdar 'dogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de shes par bya ba'i don du brdar 'dogs pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not a sign that is applied for the sake of knowing that,

original: de tha snyad kyi dus su yang mi reg pa'i phyir gzhan spangs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de tha snyad kyi dus su yang mi reg pa'i phyir gzhan spangs nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then even at the time of convention it would not touch it, and therefore it would not operate by way of exclusion.

original: de rnams kyi de dag las tha dad pa de sgras brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi de dag las tha dad pa de sgras brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: That difference of those from those is not expressed by the word.

original: mnyan pa de ni /
analyzed: mnyan pa de ni /
translated: That hearing

original: de byed min la de byed dang // 'dra ba'i ngo bo snang ba can //
analyzed: de byed min la de byed dang // 'dra ba'i ngo bo snang ba can //
translated: is like the appearance of the nature of that which is not its cause.

original: dngos po tha dad dngos tsam gyis //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad dngos tsam gyis //
translated: By the mere thing that is different from those things,

original: sa bon can don med pa'i blo //
analyzed: sa bon can don med pa'i blo //
translated: the mind that has that as its seed is meaningless.

original: skyed par byed pa'ang de mi byed //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'ang de mi byed //
translated: It is not the producer of that.

original: yongs spong yan lag ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: yongs spong yan lag ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the nature of the part that is completely excluded.

original: dngos po tha dad rten can phyir //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad rten can phyir //
translated: Because it is based on the difference of things,

original: don la mi bslu yin par 'dod //
analyzed: don la mi bslu yin par 'dod //
translated: it is considered to be nondeceptive with regard to the object.

original: de'i phyir gzhan sel yul can de //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan sel yul can de //
translated: Therefore, the object of the exclusion of other

original: de byed brten pa'i ngo bo'i byed //
analyzed: de byed brten pa'i ngo bo'i byed //
translated: is the entity that is the basis of the activity of that.üîΩBecause the mind that superimposes that on objects that are devoid of a single nature appears as a mistaken cognition, it is not a producer of activity.

original: ngo bo nyid gcig dang bral ba'i don rnams la de sgro btags nas skye ba'i blo phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir bya ba byed pa ma yin yang de byed pa lta bur @293b lhag par zhen pa'i dngos po tha dad pa'i ngo bo tsam gyis sa
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig dang bral ba'i don rnams la de sgro btags nas skye ba'i blo phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir bya ba byed pa ma yin yang de byed pa lta bur @293b lhag par zhen pa'i dngos po tha dad pa'i ngo bo tsam gyis sa
translated: However, it is a cause that produces a mistaken cognition that conceives of the mere different natures of things that are conceived as if they were the producers of activity.

original: bon can mtshungs pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa phyin ci log pa bskyed pa'i mnyan pa yang de las gzhan pa'i yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo'i phyir /
analyzed: bon can mtshungs pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa phyin ci log pa bskyed pa'i mnyan pa yang de las gzhan pa'i yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo'i phyir /
translated: The object that is the basis of the exclusion of other is the cause that produces a mistaken cognition that conceives of the mere different natures of things that are conceived as if they were the producers of activity.

original: don dam par de las tha dad pa'i don dag la mi slu ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par de las tha dad pa'i don dag la mi slu ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù with regard to objects that are different from that ultimately.

original: 'di ltar tha dad pa de ni de dag la yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad pa de ni de dag la yang dag pa yin te /
translated: Thus that difference is real in regard to them

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not to be transcended in any way.

original: tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not different or nondifferent.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable in any way.

original: de dngos po la 'god na ni sgra dang shes pa dag las dngos po thag bsrings pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dngos po la 'god na ni sgra dang shes pa dag las dngos po thag bsrings pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it were to posit a thing, then the thing would be far removed from the sound and the cognition,

original: de'i yul du 'dod pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po'i chos gzhan yang 'gags la yang reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul du 'dod pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po'i chos gzhan yang 'gags la yang reg pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not asserted to be the object of that, and because the other attributes of the thing would not be contacted.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mnyan pa de ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mnyan pa de ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can zhes bya ste /
translated: For that very reason, that hearing is called ‚Äúhaving the object of the exclusion of other,‚Äù

original: gzhan log pa'i don rnams la bye brag med par ldog pa'i khyad par la brten nas bkod pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad la yang gzhan spangs nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan log pa'i don rnams la bye brag med par ldog pa'i khyad par la brten nas bkod pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad la yang gzhan spangs nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is posited in dependence on the exclusion of other objects that are negated, and because in conventional usage, one engages in terms of the exclusion of other.

original: shing ma yin las ldog pa ni //
analyzed: shing ma yin las ldog pa ni //
translated: The exclusion of non-tree

original: shing don 'dzin na gnyis po ni //
analyzed: shing don 'dzin na gnyis po ni //
translated: If one apprehends the meaning of tree,

original: phan tshun brten pa yin pas gcig /'dzin pa med na gnyis mi 'dzin //üîΩde yi phyir na brdar gdags pa //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa yin pas gcig /'dzin pa med na gnyis mi 'dzin // de yi phyir na brdar gdags pa //
translated: then since the two are mutually dependent, if one is not apprehended, the other is not apprehended.üîΩTherefore, some say that

original: mi sred do zhes kha cig smra //
analyzed: mi sred do zhes kha cig smra //
translated: the designation of a convention is not necessary.

original: kha cig na re gal te shing ni shing ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: kha cig na re gal te shing ni shing ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa yin na /
translated: Some say: If a tree is different from non-trees,

original: de ni shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa med par de ltar gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / shing ma shes pa can gyis de rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo shing ma yin pa yang yongs su mi shes ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni shing ma yin pa 'dzin pa med par de ltar gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir dang / shing ma shes pa can gyis de rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo shing ma yin pa yang yongs su mi shes ba'i phyir /
translated: then it cannot be apprehended in that way without apprehending non-trees, and one who does not know a tree would not know the nature of the exclusion of non-tree.

original: blo la mi gnas pa'i don la brngar gdags par mi nus so zhes 'dzin to //
analyzed: blo la mi gnas pa'i don la brngar gdags par mi nus so zhes 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to designate a meaning that does not appear to the mind.

original: de dag gi ni brngar 'dogs la //
analyzed: de dag gi ni brngar 'dogs la //
translated: Their designation of a word

original: shing min rnam bar gcod dam ci //
analyzed: shing min rnam bar gcod dam ci //
translated: is the exclusion of non-tree.üîΩThose who argue that designation of a word is mutually dependent, accepting one thing and excluding others,

original: gang dag de ltar spyod dngos po cig khas blangs nas gzhan rnam par gcod pas brdar 'dogs pa la phan tshun brten pa yin par rgol ba de dag gi de la yang brngar byed pa na /
analyzed: gang dag de ltar spyod dngos po cig khas blangs nas gzhan rnam par gcod pas brdar 'dogs pa la phan tshun brten pa yin par rgol ba de dag gi de la yang brngar byed pa na /
translated: in their designation of a word,

original: shing ma yin pa rnam gcod dam //
analyzed: shing ma yin pa rnam gcod dam //
translated: is there the exclusion of non-tree?

original: 'on te ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin te /
translated: Or is it not?

original: gal te rnam gcod shing gi don //
analyzed: gal te rnam gcod shing gi don //
translated: If the meaning of tree is the exclusion,

original: 'dzin pa mad na ji ltar shes //
analyzed: 'dzin pa mad na ji ltar shes //
translated: how is it known if apprehension is incorrect?

original: de'i tshe rtogs pa pos shing yang mi shes shing ma yin pa yang mi shes te de shes par bya ba @294a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtogs pa pos shing yang mi shes shing ma yin pa yang mi shes te de shes par bya ba @294a * //
translated: At that time, the cognizer does not cognize the tree and does not cognize the non-tree.üîΩ

original: kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: kho na'i phyir /
translated: At that time, the cognizer does not know the tree, nor does he know the non-tree, because he is only engaged in knowing that.

original: de don du gnyer ba zhig tu nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don du gnyer ba zhig tu nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is engaged in that for the sake of that.

original: de mi shes pa des ji ltar brda la shing ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa rtogs par 'gyur /üîΩmi rtogs na yang de las gzhan pa yongs su ma spangs pa can 'god pa dang ldan pa'i sgra las /
analyzed: de mi shes pa des ji ltar brda la shing ma yin pa rnam par gcad pa rtogs par 'gyur / mi rtogs na yang de las gzhan pa yongs su ma spangs pa can 'god pa dang ldan pa'i sgra las /
translated: How could he understand the exclusion of non-tree through the conventional symbol by means of that non-knowledge?üîΩIf he does not understand, then from the word that does not exclude the other,

original: brda las de dag mi sel na //
analyzed: brda las de dag mi sel na //
translated: if the conventional symbol does not remove those,

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams //
translated: then those who make conventions

original: de yongs spangs nas 'jug par ni //
analyzed: de yongs spangs nas 'jug par ni //
translated: would not engage in it after completely excluding that,

original: mi 'gyur shing gi khyad par bzhin //
analyzed: mi 'gyur shing gi khyad par bzhin //
translated: like the particular tree.

original: brda'i tshe gzhan rnam par ma bcad par bkod pa'i sgra las tha snyad kyi tshe shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas 'jug par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brda'i tshe gzhan rnam par ma bcad par bkod pa'i sgra las tha snyad kyi tshe shing ma yin pa yongs su spangs nas 'jug par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that at the time of the convention, from the word that is applied without excluding the other, at the time of the convention, one would engage in it after completely excluding the non-tree,

original: shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: shing sha pa la sogs pa khyad par bzhin no //
translated: like the particular tree, etc.

original: 'on te / gal te gzhan bkag mi bsgrub par //
analyzed: 'on te / gal te gzhan bkag mi bsgrub par //
translated: But if you think that the error does not arise in this way,

original: mdun nas gcig cig rab bstan nas /
analyzed: mdun nas gcig cig rab bstan nas /
translated: and that when a particular is indicated,

original: 'di shing yin zhes brdar byed pa //
analyzed: 'di shing yin zhes brdar byed pa //
translated: and it is said, ‚ÄúThis is a tree,‚Äù

original: tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na yang //üîΩde rtogs 'gyur te de yi phyir //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs pa'i tshe na yang // de rtogs 'gyur te de yi phyir //
translated: then at the time of the designation,üîΩthe tree is understood,üîΩand therefore this error does not arise,

original: nyes pa 'di ni med snyam na //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med snyam na //
translated: then this is not so.

original: spyi dngos por smra ba ni 'ga' zhig rnam par bcad pas cung zad cig brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi dngos por smra ba ni 'ga' zhig rnam par bcad pas cung zad cig brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For those who maintain that universals are real do not say that something is expressed by the exclusion of something else.

original: 'on ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'on ci zhe na /
translated: What do they say?

original: mdun na 'dug pa'i dngos po gcig cig yang dag par bstan nas 'di ni shing yin no zhes brdar byed la /üîΩ'dis brda'i dus na de ltar mthong ba'i don kho na'am /
analyzed: mdun na 'dug pa'i dngos po gcig cig yang dag par bstan nas 'di ni shing yin no zhes brdar byed la / 'dis brda'i dus na de ltar mthong ba'i don kho na'am /
translated: They say that when a particular that is present is indicated, and it is said, ‚ÄúThis is a tree,‚ÄùüîΩthen at the time of the designation, the object that is seen in that way, or something related to it, is understood at the time of the designation.

original: de dang 'brel pa can ni tha snyad kyi tshe yang rtogs par 'gyur bas thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa can ni tha snyad kyi tshe yang rtogs par 'gyur bas thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: mi mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so.

original: 'di ltar de la yang /üîΩ'di yang shing 'di kho na zhes //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la yang / 'di yang shing 'di kho na zhes //
translated: For in that case,

original: bya bar thal bar ldog pa med //
analyzed: bya bar thal bar ldog pa med //
translated: the absurd consequence would follow that this is just that tree.

original: gcig rab tu bstan nas 'di ni shing yin no zhes smra ba yang 'di yang yin no zhe 'am /
analyzed: gcig rab tu bstan nas 'di ni shing yin no zhes smra ba yang 'di yang yin no zhe 'am /
translated: Having shown one, it is said, ‚ÄúThis is a tree.‚Äù

original: 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gnyis las ni mi gda' la /
analyzed: 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tshul gnyis las ni mi gda' la /
translated: and then to say, ‚ÄúThis is a tree,‚Äù is not to indicate it by way of the two modes, ‚ÄúThis is it‚Äù or ‚ÄúThat is it.‚Äù

original: de dag la yang nyes pa de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de dag la yang nyes pa de nyid yod do //
translated: And the same fault is present in those two modes.

original: mthong ba las bzlog pa ni nyes par sla ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mthong ba las bzlog pa ni nyes par sla ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no fault in the opposite of seeing, because it is easy to understand.

original: gcig 'ga' zhig mthong zhing gzhan la de'i rnam pas dben pa'i blo nyams su myong ba la ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de las gzhan no snyam pa chos mi mthun pa nges pa de las 'byed pa skye'o //
analyzed: gcig 'ga' zhig mthong zhing gzhan la de'i rnam pas dben pa'i blo nyams su myong ba la ni ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin de las gzhan no snyam pa chos mi mthun pa nges pa de las 'byed pa skye'o //
translated: When one sees something and experiences a cognition that is the absence of that form in another, then, just as one has experienced, one ascertains the difference, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is different from that.‚Äù

original: des ni de kho na shing yin no zhes rab tu bstan nas bye brag tu shes par bya ste /
analyzed: des ni de kho na shing yin no zhes rab tu bstan nas bye brag tu shes par bya ste /
translated: Having indicated that by that, one should understand the difference,

original: gang kho na la de mi snang ba de kho na shing ma yin par rang @294b nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang kho na la de mi snang ba de kho na shing ma yin par rang @294b nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and one will understand by oneself that whatever does not appear as that is not a tree.

original: rnam par gcod pa smra ba la ni 'di mi srid de /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa smra ba la ni 'di mi srid de /
translated: But this is impossible for the proponent of exclusion.

original: gcig na mthong ba'i ngo bo ni gang la yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig na mthong ba'i ngo bo ni gang la yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were one, then the nature of the seen would not be present in anything.

original: mthong bar rtogs na ni gsal ba gzhan pa yang de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mthong bar rtogs na ni gsal ba gzhan pa yang de ltar rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it were understood as seen, then the other clear forms would not be understood in that way.üîΩIn that case, it is the same for this.

original: de ltar na 'o na ni 'di ni de la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni 'di ni de la yang mtshungs te /
translated: Thus,

original: 'di ltar / gcig rtogs shes bya'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / gcig rtogs shes bya'i shes pa ni //
translated: The consciousness that understands one thing

original: gcig la gnas pa'i rtogs pas so //
analyzed: gcig la gnas pa'i rtogs pas so //
translated: Understands it as abiding in one.

original: de dang de min rgyu don rnams //
analyzed: de dang de min rgyu don rnams //
translated: The reasons and meanings that are not that

original: bdag nyid rnam par 'byed par byed //
analyzed: bdag nyid rnam par 'byed par byed //
translated: Are distinguished by itself.

original: 'di ni gong du ji ltar dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis tha dad kyang kha cig shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin pa ltar bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gong du ji ltar dngos po 'di dag rang bzhin gyis tha dad kyang kha cig shes pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig byed kyi gzhan dag ni ma yin pa ltar bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained above, as follows: Although these things are different by nature, some produce one effect, such as consciousness, but others do not.

original: 'dis de rnams bdag nyid kyis rnam par phye nas /
analyzed: 'dis de rnams bdag nyid kyis rnam par phye nas /
translated: This distinguishes them by itself.

original: de'i rgyu dang de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One understands the reasons and nonreasons for that.

original: de'i / blo de la ni yod pa'i dngos //
analyzed: de'i / blo de la ni yod pa'i dngos //
translated: The thing that exists for that

original: blo'i rgyu nyid du snang ba dang // rgyu min ngo bo bral ba dang // ngo bo gcig 'drar bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: blo'i rgyu nyid du snang ba dang // rgyu min ngo bo bral ba dang // ngo bo gcig 'drar bdag nyid kyis //
translated: And they are of one nature, similar to the self.

original: tha dad par ni shes 'gyur bar //
analyzed: tha dad par ni shes 'gyur bar //
translated: They are cognized as distinct.

original: tha dad pa yi skad sbyor te //
analyzed: tha dad pa yi skad sbyor te //
translated: They are connected with distinct terms.

original: de las de rtogs 'gyur ba'i blo //
analyzed: de las de rtogs 'gyur ba'i blo //
translated: The cognition that understands them

original: 'khrul pas dngos po gcig ltar rtogs //üîΩde rnams ni rang bzhin kho nas rkyen gyi dbang gi rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i rgyu rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'khrul pas dngos po gcig ltar rtogs // de rnams ni rang bzhin kho nas rkyen gyi dbang gi rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i rgyu rnams kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: Is mistaken, conceiving them as one thing.

original: de mthong ba'i blo la yod par shes pa de'i rgyu nyid dang / de las gzhan pa las ldog pas //
analyzed: de mthong ba'i blo la yod par shes pa de'i rgyu nyid dang / de las gzhan pa las ldog pas //
translated: These are the causes of such conceptual thoughts, which are due to the power of conditions, because they are the causes of the cognition that perceives them as existent and because they are distinguished from what is other than them.

original: de lta bu ma yin na yang de lta bur lhag par zhen pa /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin na yang de lta bur lhag par zhen pa /
translated: Even though they are not like that, they are conceived to be so.

original: phyi dang nang gi snyam nas khyad par rnam par ma phye ba can rnams rnam par rtog pa la rnam par gnas pas rtog pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi snyam nas khyad par rnam par ma phye ba can rnams rnam par rtog pa la rnam par gnas pas rtog pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: Thinking of them as external or internal, those who do not distinguish them remain in conceptual thought and follow conceptualization.

original: 'di dag ni shing yin no zhes rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa la gcig tu snang ba kun du bstan nas rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu yin par tha dad par shes par 'gyur snyam nas de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa la
analyzed: 'di dag ni shing yin no zhes rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pa la gcig tu snang ba kun du bstan nas rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu yin par tha dad par shes par 'gyur snyam nas de'i rgyu ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa la
translated: Thinking that the cause of that consciousness is different from the appearance that is the same in the conceptions of self and other, one posits that as different from those that are not its cause.

original: de skad sbyor te /
analyzed: de skad sbyor te /
translated: The statement is made in that way.

original: des las de rtogs pa'i blo rnam par rtog pa can ni 'khrul pa'i dbang kho nas dngos po gcig cig 'dzin pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: des las de rtogs pa'i blo rnam par rtog pa can ni 'khrul pa'i dbang kho nas dngos po gcig cig 'dzin pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: The conceptual mind that understands that object appears as if it apprehends a single thing only through the power of error.

original: de la tha dad pa mthong ba yang gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gi shing dang shing ma yin pa 'di rnam par 'byed par byed pa dngos po ltar rung ba cig ni med de /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa mthong ba yang gang zhig mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag gi shing dang shing ma yin pa 'di rnam par 'byed par byed pa dngos po ltar rung ba cig ni med de /
translated: With regard to that, seeing difference is not seeing something that is a suitable object that distinguishes this tree and non-tree, which are seen and unseen.

original: @295a * // de ni yal ga la sogs pa snang ba las tha dad par khar ba thogs pa la khar ba bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan las tha dad par ma bzung bar mi mngon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @295a * // de ni yal ga la sogs pa snang ba las tha dad par khar ba thogs pa la khar ba bzhin du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan las tha dad par ma bzung bar mi mngon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not apprehended as a staff-holder, separate from the appearance of the branches, etc., and because it is not manifest without being apprehended as separate from another.

original: rnam pa gcig la mthong ba yang gzhan la blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig la mthong ba yang gzhan la blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: And because that which is seen in one aspect is not able to see another.

original: de dang de ma yin pa dag shing dang shing ma yin pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de dang de ma yin pa dag shing dang shing ma yin pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it were that which is and is not a tree,

original: gsal ba gcig kho na shing yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gcig kho na shing yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then only one manifestation would be a tree.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra la ni don gzhan /üîΩrnam par gcod pa yod grang na //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra la ni don gzhan / rnam par gcod pa yod grang na //
translated: In the case of the word ‚Äúpot,‚Äù etc., there is a different object.üîΩBut in the case of the words ‚Äúexists,‚Äù etc., there is no different object.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig la go ji ltar yod /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig la go ji ltar yod /
translated: How can there be a different object in the words ‚Äúexists,‚Äù etc.?

original: gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ma yin pa ni cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is nothing at all that is not, from which there would be difference.

original: de las tha dad pa yul du byed pa nyid kyis de shes bya yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa yul du byed pa nyid kyis de shes bya yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is the object of the activity of differentiation,

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: that is not a fault.

original: 'di ltar / blo don 'ga' las rnam bzlog nas //
analyzed: 'di ltar / blo don 'ga' las rnam bzlog nas //
translated: Thus:üîΩIn order to turn the mind away from some objects

original: don 'ga' zhig la 'jug bya'i phyir //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig la 'jug bya'i phyir //
translated: and engage it with some other objects,

original: sgra ni rab tu sbyor byed de //
analyzed: sgra ni rab tu sbyor byed de //
translated: a word is used.

original: de'i don nges par bzung phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i don nges par bzung phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the means of ascertaining its object.

original: gzhan du sbyor ba don med 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du sbyor ba don med 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, the application would be pointless.üîΩTherefore, even for those who understand conventionally

original: des na shes bya la sogs tshig / tha snyad du ni rtogs rnams la'ang //
analyzed: des na shes bya la sogs tshig / tha snyad du ni rtogs rnams la'ang //
translated: the words ‚Äúobject of knowledge‚Äù and so on,

original: rnam par gcod pa 'ga' zhig yod //üîΩsgra rab tu sbyor bar byed pa thams cad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa 'ga' zhig yod // sgra rab tu sbyor bar byed pa thams cad ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las mi 'da' ste /
translated: there is some exclusion.

original: de ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All applications of words do not go beyond affirmation and negation, because that is the meaning of engagement and disengagement.
